tropeNotes: [The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): Take a look at his stats. He'll always be stronger and faster than everyone else in the party. He couldn't hold a candle to Sephiroth once upon a time, but now he's up to the task.
[Always Save the Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlwaysSaveTheGirl): No matter the circumstance, Cloud drops everything to save Tifa and/or Aerith if they're in danger.

[Angst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Angst): Boatloads of it. Most of it's [justified](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope) — if you came to the realization that the life you thought you had lived was a lie and you had spent the last four-five years comatose due to lab experiments after your hero burned your hometown and left you for dead and your best friend died to save your sorry hide, you'd probably have some issues to work through too.

[Animal Motifs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotifs): Wolves, specifically Fenrir, the name of the wolf that follows him in *Advent Children* and of his [Cool Bike](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolBike), which debuted in the same movie. However, this only applies to that movie.

[Anime Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimeHair): Cloud's infamous hair in *Final Fantasy VII* consists of several sharp spikes jutting into the air. *Advent Children* and related *Compilation* materials toned down the spikes to something more realistic.

[Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero): His false persona is a [Pragmatic Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PragmaticHero) variant. His real persona however, is a [Classical Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClassicalAntiHero) plagued by insecurity and self-doubt.

[Ascended Fanboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedFanboy): He idolised Sephiroth while growing up and got to fight at his side during the Nibelheim mission. Subverted in that he was only a Shinra mook at the time. Also, Sephiroth’s actions made him a case of [Broken Pedestal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenPedestal) for Cloud.

[Badass Biker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBiker): One remarkable segment in the original game is Cloud driving a bike with one hand while slaying Shinra mooks with the other. In *Advent Children* he spends much of the film riding Fenrir looking cool, and in several fight scenes fights *while* riding it.
[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): Even before Hojo's experiments. As an inexperienced 16-year old, he managed to defeat Sephiroth when they clashed.
[Batter Up!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BatterUp): One of his weapons is the Nail Bat, who can be found in the Temple of the Ancients or bought for 2800 gil at Junon after obtaining the Highwind.

[Beneath the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask): Cloud spends most of the original game posing as a cold, aloof and confident mercenary. After Tifa restores his true personality during their time in his consciousness in the Lifestream, he admits that the combination of the Jenova cells, Sephiroth's will, and his fragile ego are behind the construction of his fake persona.

[Berserker Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkerTears): It's not obvious from the sprite but [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) and says Cloud is in [Manly Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyTears) during Aerith's death scene. Cloud himself even says "His eyes are burning" when lashing out at Sephiroth/Jenova LIFE. His rage *is* obvious from the sprite, however.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): His Buster Sword is emblematic of this trope, though his other swords are no slouch either, such as the Ultima Weapon.
[Bifurcated Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BifurcatedWeapon): His Fusion Sword in *Advent Children* is *six* [BFSs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) in one.

[Black Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackKnight): Downplayed, while he isn't a knight in the traditional sense, he shares a lot in common with the Dark Knights of previous Final Fantasy games and can be considered to be adjacent to them. While Cloud doesn't particularly use dark magic, he tends towards dark aesthetics and weaponry, formerly worked for an evil (corporate) empire, is brooding and introspective, and struggles with his sense of self - all traits of Final Fantasy Dark Knights.

[Black Swords Are Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackSwordsAreBetter): [Downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope). While his eponymous ultimate weapon is bright-blade, a number of Cloud's most powerful and unique swords are black-bladed, the most obvious being the Ragnarok (his penultimate weapon) and the Apocalypse (triples AP for materia growth). His first available black sword, the Force Stealer, is also Cloud's first weapon with double AP growth capability.
[Blade Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeSpam): Omnislash, one of his [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), in a series of fifteen sword attacks.
[Blow You Away](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlowYouAway): Finishing Touch, one of his [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), launches a tornado at opponents.

[Blue Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlueIsHeroic): Played with when he was a [mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mook) at Shinra; he was still a good person but wore the blue uniform of an evil company. He goes on to wear black outfits after the original game.

[Brainwashed and Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrainwashedAndCrazy): Due to Hojo's experiments which involved injecting him with Jenova cells, Sephiroth (who has Jenova as *his* puppet) can directly take control of his body if he wants, notably when he controls him to beat up Aerith.

[Break the Haughty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakTheHaughty): As a child, Cloud avoided the other village children because he thought of himself as superior to them and like most boys his age, tried to become a hero like his idol Sephiroth by joining SOLDIER and was promptly rejected. However, it seems his claims of superiority were more a case of him trying to justify his own loneliness.

[Broken Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenAce): Being exposed to all of the brain-breaking stuff he's been exposed to has left him with serious issues. Part of the game's story is helping him out of a [Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD).

[Broken Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenHero): Cloud has self-esteem issues, stemming from being an outcast as a child and the desire to prove himself. The reason he wanted to join SOLDIER in the first place was to impress Tifa, and things went [From Bad to Worse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FromBadToWorse) once he enlisted...

[Can't Drop the Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CantDropTheHero): You typically can't remove him from the party. However, there are a few segments where you can play as a party without him, most notably when Cloud becomes comatose and has to stay in Mideel.

[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): "Not interested", repeated several times in the original game, usually as a choice in dialogue trees. In the expanded universe it's used much less often, but still pops up enough to count. [Bartz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyV) lampshades it in *Dissidia* when he mimics Cloud's voice in a match with him.

[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment): He goes from  (SPOILER) an ostracized kid who picked fights with other kids due to [Inferiority Superiority Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InferioritySuperiorityComplex), to someone who still has insecurities and self-loathing but acts nice, dorky, and awkward to others, and after his [Journey to the Center of the Mind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JourneyToTheCenterOfTheMind), he faces himself and finally accepts who he is, becoming a capable and confident leader . This is reflected right before heading for the [Very Definitely Final Dungeon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VeryDefinitelyFinalDungeon):  (SPOILER) after ignoring everyone's interests or plights unless it was for his own self-interest or [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold) moments for much of the game's first act, Cloud has managed to [develop so much](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInKindness) that he understands everyone has their own reasons for what they do and is ready to dismiss them if they want to leave at the final hour — but ultimately they all come back both because [of the journey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IveComeTooFar) and because they respect Cloud enough to take the charge compared to his begrudging leader position by happenstance before .

[Chekhov's Gunman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman): The Shinra soldier that is seen throughout Cloud's flashbacks of the Nibelheim incident? It turns out to be Cloud himself, as Zack was really the one that was in SOLDIER and was Sephiroth's partner.

[Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet): [Tifa](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GirlNextDoor), [Aerith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysticalWaif), and [Jessie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MauveShirt) have feelings for him. If you choose [Yuffie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease) as the Golden Saucer date, she kisses Cloud on the cheek on the gondola ride.

[Childhood Friend Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriendRomance): His relationship with Tifa, who also grew up in Nibelheim with him. Because both of them [Cannot Spit It Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CannotSpitItOut) though, it's ambiguous how far the romantic angle goes.

[Classical Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClassicalAntiHero): Crippling self-doubt and insecurity, tons of angst and guilt, and as a kid he was a loner. A [deconstruction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeconstructedTrope) as his crippling lack of self-worth ends up making him mentally fragile, causing him to fail to achieve his dream of becoming a SOLDIER, and being  (SPOILER) controlled by Sephiroth at critical moments in the game . [Reconstructed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReconstructedTrope) that by the end of the game he learns to accept who he is, growing to be a capable leader and can resist Sephiroth's influence as shown in the [Zero Effort](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZeroEffortBoss) [Post-Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PostFinalBoss).
[Colony Drop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonyDrop): Meteorain, one of his [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), shoots small meteors at opponents.

[The Comically Serious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheComicallySerious): Cloud tries to keep his laid back and stoic demeanor even when faced with the weirdest and most humorous situations, such as the cross-dressing sidequest.

[Composite Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CompositeCharacter): An in-universe example.  (SPOILER) The version of him from his recollection of Nibelheim is actually an amalgamation of his own history pre-Shinra and his best friend Zack Fair's personality, military history, and some actions during the Nibelheim incident.
[Courier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Courier): His career after the events of the main game; he became a deliveryman that traveled the planet.

[Crash-Into Hello](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrashIntoHello): Granted it was a [roof](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrashInThroughTheCeiling), not a person, but it's how Cloud and Aerith got formally acquainted; he crashed through the roof of her church and woke up on the flowerbed with her standing over him.

[The Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCutie): The younger, friendlier, more insecure Cloud seen in *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)* qualifies, as the young rookie who looks up to Zack.

[A Darker Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ADarkerMe): His SOLDIER persona came about as a result of the Jenova cells messing with Cloud's mind, based on Cloud's desires and what he sees as an ideal version of himself. He idolizes [Sephiroth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SugarAndIcePersonality) (pre-madness), thinks Tifa [only wants SOLDIER](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WomenPreferStrongMen), as well as views Zack as a [Big Brother Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherMentor), but he considers himself to be a failure who ended up only as a Shinra [Mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mook), and thinks of himself as weak and boring, though he remained quite friendly and sweet as seen in *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)*. Convinced that he really did live up to that ideal image, Cloud acts like a rude, aloof, cooler-than-cool, violent jerk under the SOLDIER persona, which are the traits his boyhood self viewed as "cool", "manly", and how an [Ideal Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IdealHero) acts due to his admiration of Sephiroth, while he tries to copy Zack's mannerisms and body language.
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): After the original game, he starts wearing black outfits, but is still as heroic as ever.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Cloud has a very dry wit and tends to make small quips completely straightfaced. Under his false persona in *VII* wasn't as deadpan as later, but more snarky.
QUOTE **Rufus**: Cloud, you're an ex-SOLDIER, aren't you?  
**Cloud**: In my head.
[Dead Person Conversation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadPersonConversation): Cloud is seen having conversations with both Aerith and Zack during *Advent Children*.

[Dead Person Impersonation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadPersonImpersonation): Cloud's essentially been copying an *actual* SOLDIER named Zack through most of *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*.

[Declaration of Protection](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeclarationOfProtection):
    - He [promises](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePromise) such to Tifa, and later becomes Aerith's bodyguard. - In *Advent Children*, he feels this way towards his entire family.

[Decoy Backstory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DecoyBackstory): A flashback narrated by Cloud near the beginning  (SPOILER) actually turns out to have involved his friend Zack. Cloud ended up confusing himself with Zack thanks to a combination of trauma and [Hojo's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist) experiments. This is why Cloud's narration tends to trail off and get murky throughout the flashback like he has trouble remembering much beyond a few incidental scenes. That is because he really didn't have much to recall besides all of the scenes he shared with Zack as a grunt, the few bits of info that Zack shared with him, and others that he made up in his own head .

[Depending on the Writer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DependingOnTheWriter): Cloud ranges from self-doubting and insecure [Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero) to a cocky and confident badass, sometimes in the same appearance. Justified due to the two or three personas he's adopted and come to terms with, an entirely consistent personality is probably not going to result from this.

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator): Cloud *never* gives up, even when all the odds are against him. Take the Nibelheim Incident; even with no powers or procedures yet performed to make him stronger, Cloud charges Sephiroth, widely considered the most powerful man on the planet, head-on. And even when impaled on his sword and hoisted into the air, he finds the strength to overpower him and turn the tables.
[Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad): Was raised by his mother instead. It seems his father died when Cloud was young.
[Disguised in Drag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisguisedInDrag): The infamous crossdressing quest in Wall Market, which he undertook to save Tifa.
[Doomed Hometown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown): In the backstory, Nibelheim was destroyed several years ago by Sephiroth.

[Dressing as the Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DressingAsTheEnemy): In Junon, Cloud disguises himself as a Shinra mook participating in Rufus’ welcoming ceremony, where he also has to learn the marching protocols.

[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding): As Cloud is wielding a [Bifurcated Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BifurcatedWeapon) consisting of *six* [BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) during *Advent Children*, he sometimes detach some blades from it to wield using his free hand.

[Empty Shell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmptyShell): After all the trauma he had been through, he was reduced to this when Tifa found him at the train station. His mind then constructed the Zack-like persona, in an attempt to protect him from the trauma. This happens to him again after the mako poisoning, and he remains like this until Tifa helps him rebuild his own mind and regain his memories.

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): Subverted. Cloud’s first appearance has him stylishly jumping from a train and acting like a cold and uncaring jerk. Yet, this entire personality displayed turns out to be a fabrication, brought about by a combination of Jenova's cells, trauma, and Hojo's experiments.
[Fake Memories](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FakeMemories): Though it's something of a journey to figure out how and why he has them.

[Fashionable Asymmetry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FashionableAsymmetry): Cloud wears only one shoulder pad, on his left shoulder. It’s best seen in his official artwork, but is a feature of most of his outfits in the Compilation.

[Flanderization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flanderization): If you haven't played the original game, you'll be surprised at how *non* angsty Cloud was. He *did* angst and express hesitation and insecurities, but only at key points and for good reasons, and at the end of the game seemed perfectly fine. In his appearances since, he has been an angsty brooding loner. [Square Enix](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/SquareEnix) states outright in *The Reunion Files* (basically the *Ultimania* for *Advent Children*) that they regressed his personality back to a mindset they thought fans would be more familiar with.
[Girlish Pigtails](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GirlishPigtails): His disguise while infiltrating Don Corneo's mansion sees Cloud style his hair this way.

[Graceful Ladies Like Purple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GracefulLadiesLikePurple): His disguise while infiltrating Don Corneo's mansion sees Cloud don a violet dress. Cloud's projected composed demeanor during that point in the game also adds to the demure.
[Guest Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestFighter): In *[Ehrgeiz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/Ehrgeiz)*, an obscure fighting game made by Square in late 1990s.

[Guilt Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuiltComplex): Has a severe case of this. He often feels guilty for things out of his control, like his reaction when he failed to save a scientist under his care in *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)* or cursing himself for failing his promise to Tifa when he falls in battle, or also acting as if the Jenova taking over his body for Reunion and creating his false persona as his doing and his fault, or his depression in *Advent Children*.

[Hair-Contrast Duo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairContrastDuo): Cloud falls into this with three characters.
    - Cloud (shortish spiky hair, golden blond, pragmatic but unstable) and his rival Sephiroth (really long flowing hair, silver, otherworldly and collected). - Cloud (short blond spiky hair, pessimistic and more innocent) and his idol Zack (long black spiky hair, optimistic and more experienced). Note also that Zack's hairstyle was actually based on an early design for Cloud's that was changed because it wasn't striking enough - Cloud is the main character, while Zack is a backstory character whose entire existence is obscured from the player, with the ironic concept that he's a more 'main character'-type person than Cloud. - Cloud, (male, short blond hair, cool and collected when he's not being mind raped) and Tifa (female, long brown/black hair, enthusiastic (but keeps a lot of secrets to herself, and suffers for it).

tropeName: Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairOfGoldHeartOfGold): Cloud's real personality is a noble and heroic man who just happened to be plagued by self-doubt and insecurity, as displayed in *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)*. After a [Journey to the Center of the Mind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JourneyToTheCenterOfTheMind), this aspect of him returns with a vengeance, albeit hardened by his recent experiences, and a lot more determined.

[Hairstyle Inertia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairstyleInertia): The flashback sequences in Nibelheim and later installments in the Compilation show that Cloud had that same spiky hair as a child and as a teenager.

[Heroes Prefer Swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesPreferSwords): [BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS)'s are preferred, although he does have a few katanas. As an infantryman, however, he favored an assault rifle and police baton.

[Heroic Resolve](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicResolve): In his actual showdown with Sephiroth in the past, he managed to toss him into the Lifestream chasm below them, while being stabbed in the gut by his sword and lifted in the air. Keep in mind Cloud isn’t a part of SOLDIER and was just a lowly mook at the time.

[Heroic Self-Deprecation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSelfDeprecation): He really hated his own real personality so much that his ideal version of himself  (SPOILER) as presented by the Jenova cells  is basically a mishmash of [Sephiroth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHerosIdol) and [Zack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherMentor), who are both  (SPOILER) actual  SOLDIERs. Fortunately, he grows out of it and learns to accept himself for who he is.

[Heroic Wannabe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicWannabe): Part of Cloud's arc in the original game is dissecting how silly and immature his idea of what a cool and badass hero is like in an attempt to be the person he thinks Tifa will be impressed by, being a standoffish and aloof dick. His misguided aims of being a hero allow Sephiroth to exert control over him and allow him to summon Meteor. Once Tifa pieces his memories back together, Cloud goes back to his true [Adorkable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Adorkable) [Dork Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DorkKnight) personality and proves himself [A True Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ATrueHero) in the end instead by accepting his flaws and thus, himself.

[Heroic Willpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicWillpower): Cloud fails at this throughout the game, with his issues of self-identity and self-loathing making him an easy puppet to Sephiroth’s mind controlling. However, he fully achieves this at his very final battle with Sephiroth, who is trying to break Cloud again, without success.

[I Let Gwen Stacy Die](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ILetGwenStacyDie): He stood helpless and watched as Sephiroth killed Aerith. More in *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren)* than in the game.
[Iconic Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicOutfit): Cloud's original purple outfit from the original game and the all-black *Advent Children* outfit are equally well-known among the fandom.

[Iconic Starter Equipment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicStarterEquipment): Cloud's Buster Sword is what most people picture him wielding and it's the weapon he wields in all spinoffs, cameo appearances, etc. In *[Final Fantasy VII Remake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIIRemake)* it's even given [Magikarp Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagikarpPower) properties so that it stays viable even after the acquisition of other swords, whereas in the original game you'll ditch it and never look back as soon as you get another sword.

[Inferiority Superiority Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InferioritySuperiorityComplex): As a child, he thought himself better than other kids, though he later admits he did so out of self-loathing. As a grown man, following the Nibelheim tragedy, Cloud developed an arrogant mercenary persona,  (SPOILER) unaware that he's just acting out his idealized self-image, brought about by the Jenova cells implanted in him messing with his mind and taking advantage of his fractured memories .

[Instant Expert](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstantExpert): Cloud is shown driving multiple vehicles throughout the game. He drove a motorbike, a dune buggy given to his party by Dio, pilots a submarine and the Highwind.
[Interspecies Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterspeciesRomance): Cloud is a human who has a growing attraction to Aerith, the last of the Cetra race.
[Jack of All Stats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JackOfAllStats): Cloud has all around good stats and can fight with magic or weapons as needed.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): Subverted. Cloud isn't actually a jerk, his unsavory behavior for most of the game was done by his false persona created by  (SPOILER) the Jenova cells  after the events leading up to Zack's death.

tropeName: Journey to the Center of the Mind
tropeNotes: [Journey to the Center of the Mind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JourneyToTheCenterOfTheMind): After the WEAPON attack in Mideel, Cloud and Tifa fall into the Lifestream, where she then enters his mind and help him regain his sense of self.
[Katanas Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter): Two of his swords are the Murasame and the Yoshiyuki, though Cloud generally favors western styled broadswords.

[Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen): His Finishing Touch [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) has Cloud doing a [One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill) by flinging enemies upwards. The standard dying sound effect would then be heard to confirm the deaths.

[The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader): To the party. He's got elements of a Levelheaded leader and Headstrong leader as he displays a focused if aloof personality and sense of determination that keeps the party going in their hunt for Sephiroth.

[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): Cloud moves fast and has enough HP and stamina to take a good hit, and when he hits back it hurts a lot. Spin-offs like *Dissidia* and *Kingdom Hearts* instead depict him as a [Mighty Glacier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MightyGlacier), moving and attacking slowly but doing a lot of damage.

[Likes Older Women](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikesOlderWomen): When it comes to his attraction to Aerith, who is one year older than him. In fact, his mother once suggested that he find an older girlfriend. Subverted if he gets together with Tifa, who is one year younger than Cloud, if his [Relationship Values](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RelationshipValues) with her is high enough.

[Loners Are Freaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonersAreFreaks): As a child he was anti-social and constantly got into fights because of his [All of the Other Reindeer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllOfTheOtherReindeer) status and [Inferiority Superiority Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InferioritySuperiorityComplex).

[Made of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfIron): He survived a huge fall from the Shinra Headquarters to the Midgar Church and also managed to overpower Sephiroth while being impaled on the chest by him.
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Cloud fulfills this in terms of gameplay, dealing lots of damage through his swordsmanship and spells.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Cloud Strife, reflecting his inner turmoil and troubled life.

[The Mentally Disturbed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMentallyDisturbed): Cloud's an emotionally fragile young man who suffers from bouts of depression, has a history of shutting down when life becomes too much to handle, and has serious problems with acknowledging his own self-worth while struggling against an evil parasitic entity's attempts to manipulate him further through his misguided false persona. In spite of this, he soldiers on, and manages to overcome or mitigate many of these issues.

[Meteor-Summoning Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeteorSummoningAttack): His appropriately named Meteorrain [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) allows Cloud to produce several meteors from his [BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) to strike multiple enemies.

[Momma's Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MommasBoy): Cloud describes his mother as “vibrant” and once invited Zack to come to his house and try her cooking. Her death at the hands of Sephiroth is one of his (many) grudges against him.
[Mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mook): In his backstory, it is shown this was his true rank within Shinra. He was just another one of the guards the party guns down the entire game.

[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): He does this for the tutorial near the start of the game, explaining Materia and Limit Breaks in detail to the player under the guise of teaching his fellow party members in-universe.
[Mr. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFanservice): Well-built, handsome, heroic, and very badass.

[Muscles Are Meaningless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MusclesAreMeaningless): Cloud is portrayed as a rather odd-looking and emaciated young man yet he wields the Buster Sword like if it was nothing. It is justified because of his Mako enhancements. Downplayed in that he's still got a decent amount of muscle on him to stop him from being unhealthily thin.
[New Meat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NewMeat): He’s the most recent addition to AVALANCHE when the story begins. In fact, the very first line of the game has Barret calling him “newcomer”.

[Not Himself](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotHimself): His character journey is all about this. Due to the combination of his low self-esteem, traumatic experiences, being in coma, being experimented on, having his mind literally shattered, and the influence of Jenova cells injected in his body, he spent a good amount in this game behaving like his best friend  (SPOILER) Zack , presenting himself as a SOLDIER  (SPOILER) which in reality he failed to enter, unlike Zack , and acting as a cold-hearted mercenary. This ends after a [Journey to the Center of the Mind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JourneyToTheCenterOfTheMind) to put his mind back together and Cloud accepting himself for who he is, growing stronger shown by resisting Sephiroth's influence on him.
[Occult Blue Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OccultBlueEyes): They also glow because of his Mako infusion; this is a mark of all members of SOLDIER.

[One-Handed Zweihänder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHandedZweihander): In the original game alone, Cloud slashed Shinra mooks with one hand on the Buster Sword and the other riding a bike. Also, his famous victory animation has him twirling his blade with one arm.
[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill): His Finishing Touch [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) has a chance to kill multiple enemies with one swing.

[Only I Can Kill Him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyICanKillHim): Spin-offs seem to give him this role regarding Sephiroth, who shrugs off beatings from the [Warrior of Light](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DissidiaFinalFantasy) or [Sora](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/KingdomHearts).
[The Paralyzer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParalyzer): Cross-Slash, one of his Limit Breaks, can randomly cast Stop on an opponent.

[People Jars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PeopleJars): Cloud was subject to this for years alongside Zack at Shinra’s hands. Both were thoroughly experimented on before Zack broke out and rescued Cloud along the way.
[Pink Girl, Blue Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PinkGirlBlueBoy): At least in the original game, Cloud wore a blue outfit while Aerith had a pink dress. Later games have him wearing black.

[Puppeteer Parasite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PuppeteerParasite): Hojo's experiments involve injecting his subjects, including Cloud, with Jenova cells. After Cloud becomes an [Empty Shell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmptyShell) due to Mako poisoning,  (SPOILER) the Jenova cells take over his body to be used as a puppet for Reunion, creating a false persona based on Cloud's desires with [Fake Memories](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FakeMemories) to match, but the persona the player sees through most of the game. Sephiroth, who himself controls Jenova, by extension also can take control of Cloud if he wants. This ends after a [Journey to the Center of the Mind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JourneyToTheCenterOfTheMind) where Cloud accepts himself and becomes stronger, resisting Sephiroth's influence in a [Zero-Effort Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZeroEffortBoss).
[Purple Is Powerful](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PurpleIsPowerful): Cloud's original game outfit is the purple SOLDIER 1st class uniform.
[The Quiet One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheQuietOne): On his own Cloud is a fairly shy and silent figure.
[Replacement Goldfish](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReplacementGoldfish): Initially, what draws Aerith to Cloud is his resemblance to Zack.

[Right Handed Mirror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RightHandedMirror): To Sephiroth. Both are the result of experimentation with Mako and Jenova cells, but while right-handed Cloud regains his sanity and becomes a hero, Sephiroth descends into an [Omnicidal Maniac](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OmnicidalManiac).

[The Scape Goat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheScapeGoat): As a child, Cloud got blamed for an accident that involved Tifa falling down a bridge while trying to head up Mt. Nibel, but the truth is he was only trying to save her, and it was actually Tifa's own fault for running there on her own volition. Cloud never bothered to try and defend himself, since by that point he was already well aware that anything he'd say in his defense would've just fallen on deaf ears, being the ostracized kid that he was.

[Sleeves Are for Wimps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleevesAreForWimps): All of Cloud's outfits are sleeveless (except maybe for shoulder guards) and he fights using [very large swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS).
[Spam Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpamAttack): His final [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), Omnislash, allows him to critically attack enemies fifteen times.

[Still Wearing the Old Colors](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StillWearingTheOldColors): Cloud still wears the same SOLDIER outfit even after he’s working against them. Subverted in that he never was actually part of SOLDIER and his current costume is just one Zack found and gave to him.

[Strong and Skilled](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongAndSkilled): A combination of infantry training and super soldier experiments has given him super strength, agility and endurance. These attributes are coupled with his skills as a swordsman which develop as he gains more and more [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).

[Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier): SOLDIER was comprised of humans who were exposed to large amounts of raw Mako (giving them their distinctive [Glowing Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlowingEyes)) and, in some cases, injected with Jenova cells, granting them superhuman strength, speed, and agility. While Cloud was never in SOLDIER, Hojo's experiments were similar, if not identical, to the process of creating a SOLDIER.

[Sword Beam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordBeam): Blade Beam, one of his [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), fires a blast of energy from his sword. When targeting multiple opponents, additional beams sprout from the original to attack the other targets.
[Take Up My Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeUpMySword): When Zack dies, Cloud literally takes up his sword and keeps his dreams of honor and heroism alive in his own way.

[This Loser Is You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisLoserIsYou): He was a [Deconstruction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Deconstruction) of RPG protagonists at the time. Turns out that when he was younger, he picked fights with the other kids to hide his insecurities and decided he would join SOLDIER in order to impress the girl he'd had a crush on for years but never had the courage to ask out. When this attempt failed due to his stated insecurities and mental fragility, followed by his hometown being burned down by the man he idolized, followed by his best friend in the world — an actual member of SOLDIER — being gunned down before his eyes, he lost his sense of self and got his body taken over by  (SPOILER) Jenova cells , of which it's shown that his ideal version of himself is pretending to be that best friend, of which only got realized due to Hojo's experiment being identical to the process of creating a SOLDIER, giving him the same powers and capabilities as them, as well as  (SPOILER) the Jenova cells  altering his memories to be said best friend's ones. The real personality of Cloud is stuck on his head, but has to learn to accept his own weakness and shortcomings later on.

[Tomato in the Mirror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomatoInTheMirror): See [Dead Person Impersonation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadPersonImpersonation). When he finds out the truth he does not take it well at all.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): From a story standpoint, he went from a shy, ostracized kid to a powerful warrior who defeated the all-powerful Sephiroth. Gameplay-wise, this is represented with his lackluster stats in the flashback (as a lv. 1 party member) sequence when compared to how he began the game.

[Took a Level in Kindness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInKindness): As a child, Cloud and his mother were ostracized by most of Nibelheim's population, causing him to wallow in self-loathing, which in turn led to him developing an [Inferiority Superiority Complex](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InferioritySuperiorityComplex) and got into fights with other boys. After an accident in Mt. Nibel that resulted in him getting blamed for Tifa's injury, he became more withdrawn. Following the traumatic events of the Nibelheim massacre and the injection of Jenova cells into his body, Cloud's fractured mental state gives birth to a false persona where he thinks he's supposed to be an arrogant, reckless, obsessive, and deliberately antagonistic person, but his inner goodness still shines through when it really counts, and he becomes a full [Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy) after the lifestream reminds him who he really is and he finally accepts himself as a person.

[Too Many Belts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooManyBelts): In *Advent Children*. The retconned SOLDIER 1st Class costumes from *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)* that he wears has two.

[Tragic Keepsake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TragicKeepsake): The Buster Sword is not just for combat: It’s also Cloud’s way of carrying on Zack’s legacy and dreams. He learns to do it by being his own person however, and not pretending to be Zack.

[Trauma Conga Line](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TraumaCongaLine): Goes through all of this before the game even starts:
    - Hoped to join SOLDIER but didn't end up strong enough. So he joined the regular military, befriending Zack and Sephiroth. Then he watched his idol fall into mass-murdering insanity and god-delusion and seemingly defeated him along with Zack. - Then, the two get captured by Shinra and are subjected to horrific experiments with Mako. Zack managed to break out and rescue Cloud from their fate, but is gunned down by mooks, and Cloud could do nothing but watch.

[Trauma-Induced Amnesia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TraumaInducedAmnesia): After the massive amount of tragedy he experienced before the game even started, the Jenova cells altered his memories with his fallen friend Zack's own, and has to block said traumatizing true memories to keep his mind from collapsing, causing his headaches.

[Troll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll): Through dialogue options, it's very possible to make Cloud give some pretty dickish responses purely for the lulz of it all. He even appears to be this canonically, as shown from his frequent teasing of Barret during the Midgar section of the game. It gets dropped for the most part after he undergoes his [Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD), which indicates that it may well have been another element he picked up from Zack.
[Troubled, but Cute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TroubledButCute): He wears all black and copes with a lot of mental issues, but is very good-looking and has a good heart.

[The Unchosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUnchosenOne): Contrasts with Sephiroth's self-proclaimed status as [The Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChosenOne). Cloud was a random Shinra grunt who had no connection with Sephiroth or anybody else involved with Shinra outside of an unlikely friendship with first class SOLDIER Zack. By all rights, he should've ended up just another of the endless mobs of enemies the party mow down. Through happenstance, Sephiroth's petty fixation on making him suffer for besting him, and his own personal courage, Cloud perseveres and proves himself to be [the greatest hero of them all.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ATrueHero)

[Unknown Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnknownRival): Hojo doesn't remember who he is when they have their last battle.
QUOTE **Cloud:** At least remember my name!

[Weapon Twirling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeaponTwirling): As part of his victory animation, his spins his sword in the air before shouldering it over his back. He can do it with a rifle when disguised as a Shinra soldier during Rufus’ welcoming ceremony in Junon. It's implied - and later confirmed in *Crisis Core* - that this was a move he picked up from Zack.
[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): He beats up Aerith in the Temple of the Ancients, causing her to leave the party. Granted, he was being controlled, but still…

[White Male Lead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMaleLead): Cloud is the protagonist in a noticeably diverse cast for its time and even today, with a black man (Barret), an Asian woman (Yuffie) and two furries (Red XIII and Cait Sith). Averted within AVALANCHE, where Barret is the leader.

[Wholesome Crossdresser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WholesomeCrossdresser): A certain, ahem, ["noble incident"](http://finalfantasy.wikia.com/wiki/File:Miss_Cloud_Artwork.png)◊. So wholesome that Don Corneo can choose him!

[Your Days Are Numbered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourDaysAreNumbered): In *Advent Children*, where he has contracted the fatal Geostigma. He gets cured by the end, and lives on to appear in *Dirge of Cerberus*.

["Angry Black Man" Stereotype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngryBlackManStereotype): Especially early in the game, he has a very short temper. It's [justified](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope) later on in the game when Barret explains just *why* he's so angry to begin with.
[Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero): He's frequently angry and fighting for personal reasons, but deep down he's a good person.
[Arm Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArmCannon): Although some of his weapons turn it into a [Power Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFist) instead.
[Artificial Limbs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialLimbs): His gun arm is able to transform into a robotic hand in *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren)*.

[Big Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood): From *his* perspective in the beginning of the game, given that he's leading AVALANCHE and giving orders to Cloud & co. He gradually comes to realize that maybe he wasn't quite as noble as he thought.

[Boisterous Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoisterousBruiser): [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) turns Barret into one of these later on. He's still emotional and outgoing, but no longer quite as trigger-happy.

[Captain Ersatz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CaptainErsatz):
    - He looks and acts *very* similar to [Mr. T](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/MrT). When he got a voice actor for later appearances he even talks like him. - The audiobooks for *On the Way to a Smile* has him sound more like [Chi McBride](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/ChiMcBride).
[Chainsaw Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainsawGood): One of his gun-arms is a chainsaw attachment.

[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment): Barret goes through profound character development throughout Final Fantasy VII. Initially entrenched in his beliefs about Shinra and resorting to violence and terrorism, he experiences a transformative journey during the events of the game, especially during his confrontation with Dyne. He eventually recognize the faults in his actions strives to be a more virtuous individual.
[Cluster F-Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClusterFBomb): Not exactly an F-bomb, but Barret is very prone to cursing up a storm when he flies into a rage.

[Cuteness Proximity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutenessProximity): *Very* easy to miss, but if he's in your party when you visit the hidden cockatrice nest on Mt. Corel, Barret flips out over how adorable the chicks are.
QUOTE **Barret:** Haeey!! Baaeby!!

[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove): His final [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), Catastrophe, sees Barret jumping [In a Single Bound](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InASingleBound) and then unleashing a [Wave-Motion Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaveMotionGun) while suspended on the air.

[Discard and Draw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscardAndDraw): Barrett can switch from his standard [Long-Range Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongRangeFighter) class to a melee combatant by equipping him with certain weapons (specifically [Atomic Scissors](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerPincers), [Cannon Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpikeBallsOfDoom), [This Is a Drill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsADrill), and [Rocket Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RocketPunch)), though he's primarily the former.

[Dub Personality Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubPersonalityChange): Partially. The localization features him speaking predominantly in Ebonics, a linguistic style absent in the Japanese version. Averted in Advent Children and future titles.
[Energy Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnergyBall): Big Shot and Mindblow fire orbs of energy. Big Shot is orange, Mindblow is blue.
[Expository Hairstyle Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpositoryHairstyleChange): Sports a pulled back cornrow by the time of *Advent Children*.

[Gatling Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GatlingGood): His default weapon is a Gatling gun mounted to his right arm. Because it's used frequently in cutscenes, it's one of two weapons in the game that cannot be sold, the other being Cloud's Buster Sword.

[Grenade Launcher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrenadeLauncher): His Grenade Bomb [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) has his gun arm be [Exactly What It Says on the Tin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin).

[Handicapped Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandicappedBadass): He's missing his right arm, but he makes it work by replacing it with an [Arm Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArmCannon) and kicking ass with it.

[Harpoon Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HarpoonGun): His Pile Banger is a weird subversion. It is classified and functions as a long-ranged weapon but Barret's attack animation while equipped with it is the same as his melee weapons.
[Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded): Barret is very open and eager in his desire to topple Shinra.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): He's angry and foul-mouthed, but is a good man deep down.
[Kill Sat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillSat): Satellite Beam brings down a laser strike from above.
[Large and in Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeAndInCharge): Barret is one of the tallest characters in the game, has a very imposing demeanor, and leads the extremist group AVALANCHE.
[Mana Burn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManaBurn): His Mindblow [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) depletes a single enemy's MP completely.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): 'Barret' means "mighty bear", fitting his imposing stature and aggressive personality. What makes the meaning of his name stick even more is when the team first visits Costa del Sol after stowing away on the Shinra Cargo Ship, where Cloud jokes that Barret looked like a bear in a marshmallow while disguised as a sailor.

[Mighty Glacier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MightyGlacier): He's slow and not very good with magic, but he can take a tremendous amount of punishment and is very good at blowing things up with his gun weapons.

[Morality Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityPet): His daughter, Marlene, is the only thing keeping him from going off the deep end. Barret is aware of this trope and notes if he didn't have Marlene motivating him to be a good dad for her, he may have become something worse a long time ago.

[Moral Myopia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralMyopia): Initially, he doesn't care about the lives of many people besides his loved ones (e.g. his daughter Marlene, his Avalanche colleagues who died early on except Tifa, and his Corel community). He fights Shinra primarily out of revenge, and his self-righteous [Saving the World](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SavingTheWorld) claims are just his self-justification. Later on, Cait Sith [calls him out for it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero), and Barret eventually acknowledges that he was wrong.

[More Dakka](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoreDakka): Angermax fires 18 attacks from his gun-arm at random enemies. Numerous strategies rely on maximizing his power for 18 hits of 9,999 damage, making it the most powerful attack in the game against single foes.
[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed): Barret is clearly inspired by [Mr. T](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/MrT), in looks and mannerisms.
[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill): Hammer Blow has a chance to instantly kill the target.
[Papa Wolf](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PapaWolf): You do not hurt Marlene, unless you want the full fury of his rage brought down on you.
[Parental Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalSubstitute): He's not really Marlene's dad, but acts as such.
[Perma-Stubble](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermaStubble): Has a very short beard to compliment his action-oriented occupation.

[Power Pincers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerPincers): Atomic Scissors, which is Barret's first potential close-range arm attachment if the player steals from the Custom Sweeper monster on the world map upon leaving Midgar. If the player missed on stealing it, they could buy it from either Junon or Gongaga weapon shops.
[Progressively Prettier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProgressivelyPrettier): *Advent Children* prettied him up somewhat. And gave him *a fishnet vest.*

[Quickly-Demoted Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuicklyDemotedLeader): The original game begins with Barret as [The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader) of AVALANCHE. Cloud essentially takes over following the fall of Sector 7 (plus the deaths of Jesse, Biggs, and Wedge effectively ended the group anyways), and officially once the party leaves Midgar. Then when Cloud is temporarily off the board during Disc 2, Tifa briefly leads the group until they get Cloud to safety, but after that, she steps out and Barret becomes the obvious choice for team leader. Except that Barret admits that he's a terrible leader and instead picks Cid on the grounds that the latter is an experienced commander and the best-suited for the role.
[Rebel Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelLeader): Leads AVALANCHE, an extremist group hell-bent on destroying the Mako reactors hurting the planet.
[Rocket Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RocketPunch): His [Joke Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JokeWeapon) replaces his gun-arm with a giant red fist.
[Scary Black Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScaryBlackMan): He's large and intimidating in addition to having a gun attached to his arm.

[Shoot the Television](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShootTheTelevision): An NPC mentions that he once did this using his gun arm with a Sector 7 television monitor that was displaying a broadcast by President Shinra. He didn't win any fans that day, as the only other television in Sector 7 was in AVALANCHE headquarters.
[Sir Swears-a-Lot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SirSwearsALot): Alongside Cid, most of the cursing in the game comes from him.

[Sleeves Are for Wimps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleevesAreForWimps): All of Barret's outfits are sleeveless, is the largest and most imposing of the main characters, and he fights with a literal [Arm Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArmCannon).
[Spike Balls of Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpikeBallsOfDoom): He could be attached to one called Cannon Ball. It could be bought from Kalm and Junon weapon shops.
[Swiss-Army Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwissArmyWeapon): His gun-arm has numerous different attachments besides guns.

[This Is a Drill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsADrill): He has a weapon called Drill Arm. It doubles his materia's AP gains when equipped. It could be found on Cid's house or bought at Junon after obtaining Highwind.
[Throw Down the Bomblet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowDownTheBomblet): Grenade Bomb fires a grenade at opponents.

[Trigger-Happy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TriggerHappy): Early in the game, he tends to open fire when he gets angry. If the player doesn't advance the dialogue in some situations, this can go on for a *[long](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BottomlessMagazines)* time.

[Walking the Earth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingTheEarth): Novellas set after the game say that he grew restless living in Edge and set out into the world to find a way to atone for his actions in AVALANCHE. He seems to have settled on "help fix the mess he created" as of *Advent Children*.
[Wave-Motion Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaveMotionGun): His final Limit Break Catastrophe has him leap into the air and fire a *massive* laser at opponents.
[Well-Intentioned Extremist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WellIntentionedExtremist): At first. He later acknowledges that his actions might not have been best.

tropeName: When All You Have Is a Hammer…
tropeNotes: [When All You Have Is a Hammer…](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenAllYouHaveIsAHammer): His solution to most problems seems to involve [More Dakka](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoreDakka).
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Tifa's far better with her fists than with magic.
[Action Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionMom): Due to her [Parental Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalSubstitute) relationship with Denzel.

[Adaptational Modesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdaptationalModesty): Her [in-game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII) outfit bares a lot of midriff. Her *Advent Children* one only shows a sliver.

[Animal Motif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotif): Tifa has a dolphin theme in her dolphin shaped hair and one of her Limit Breaks is a Dolphin blow. It also comes up that probably her most important scene is helping Cloud find himself when he is lost in the watery-looking livestream.
[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): Whenever she goes deredere to Cloud, which is... damn near the whole time.
[Badass Damsel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassDamsel): Despite being able to kick her fair share of ass, Tifa still needs to be saved by Cloud now and then.
[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): Tifa doesn't have an ancient heritage, or Mako in her veins, but she can still keep up with the best of them.
[Bare-Fisted Monk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareFistedMonk): Her combat style is based on this character class.
[The Bartender](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBartender): Tifa tends bar at 7th Heaven.

[Beauty Is Never Tarnished](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeautyIsNeverTarnished): She attempted to attack Sephiroth with his own Masamune katana during the Nibelheim Incident, only to be casually disarmed and slashed near-fatally with the blade. Despite the fact that he killed everyone else in no time flat with a single slash each, Tifa holds no scarring over the incident whatsoever. A side book for the *Remake* continuity, *[Trace of Two Pasts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Literature/FinalFantasyVIIRemakeTraceOfTwoPasts)*, actually answered this with expensive skin transplants done to cover up what should've been otherwise permanent.

[Buxom Beauty Standard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BuxomBeautyStandard): She's a major [Dude Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeMagnet) towards most of the boys her age, Cloud included, due to her large bust.

[Cannot Spit It Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CannotSpitItOut):  (SPOILER) She knows something is very wrong with Cloud from the beginning, particularly after hearing his version of how the Nibelheim tragedy went down, but can't bring herself to mention it. Specifically, as far as she was aware, Cloud was never *there*, as he is recounting the story from Zack's perspective when in reality Cloud was a random Shinra grunt. She seems to keep it to herself because she's worried about Cloud's mental state, but eventually, it all catches up to him and he falls into a Mako induced [Angst Coma](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngstComa).

[Charles Atlas Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharlesAtlasSuperpower): Does as much damage with her fists as others with actual weapons. Then there's her [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) which [continually gets bigger and bigger until her fist causes an explosion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SerialEscalation).
[Childhood Friend Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriendRomance): She and Cloud grew up together in Nibelheim and end up living together as a family after the game's events.
[Combat Parkour](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatParkour): Seen in her fight against Loz in *Advent Children* in which she did Tic Tacs and wall clings.

[Converse with the Unconscious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConverseWithTheUnconscious): In *Case of Tifa*, she asks Cloud if he loves her while he's sleeping. Her voice wakes him up, and she quickly changes the question.

[Critical Hit Class](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CriticalHitClass): A certain weapon/Materia combination can make her this. Equip her God Hand (2nd best weapon) with has a hit rate of 255 percent (way overkill because all it takes is a 100 percent rate to never miss), and the Deathblow Command, which is a guaranteed critical in exchange for halving the hit rate, will always hit as half of 255 is still over 100 percent. Additionally, several of her weapons throughout the game boost the chances of her landing a critical hit.
[Cute Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CuteBruiser): Possibly the cutest member of the team, and rivals Cloud as the physically strongest.
[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): On occasion, interestingly it is her romantic fantasy to be the damsel in distress that a dashing hero will save.

[Desperation Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesperationAttack): Two of her weapons have damage formulas that boost her attacking power when she's at low HP, has status ailments inflicted, and/or allies are KO'd.

[Deuteragonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Deuteragonist): In *Advent Children*, Tifa is clearly the story's focus after Cloud and she is the one usually filling him in on what's happening. In all versions, her voice actress is credit second after Cloud's.

[Everyone Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneHasStandards): Notably, next to Aerith she's the moralistic member of the party. When the Sector 7 Plate drops, Tifa is the one questioning if [it's AVALANCHE's fault](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGodWhatHaveIDone) for merely existing in the vicinity to cause so much death and destruction with Shin-Ra's retaliation, and when Rufus has her and Barret set up for execution, she's the one that thinks they deserve it even if she ultimately does break out on her own will.
[Expository Hairstyle Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpositoryHairstyleChange): She ditches the dolphin-like ponytail in *Advent Children*.
[Girl Next Door](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GirlNextDoor): A sweet and compassionate girl with maternal streak who lived next door to Cloud pre-series.
[Girly Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GirlyBruiser): She is feminine, yes, but she is the strongest of the female party members.
[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): Tifa can deal out a lot of punishment in a fight, but she has a harder time taking it.

[Greater Need Than Mine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreaterNeedThanMine): In Don Corneo's mansion, if Aerith is selected as the Don's date, Tifa and Cloud meet in the hallway. She's thinking only of Aerith's safety, and not her own. If Cloud asks her if she's okay instead of saying "We've gotta help Aerith!", she'll be unhappy with him and he'll lose [Relationship Values](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RelationshipValues).
[Guest Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestFighter): Cameos as a playable character in *[Ehrgeiz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/Ehrgeiz)*.
[Hair Color Dissonance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairColorDissonance): In some depictions her hair is light brown, while other times it's such a dark brown it looks black.

[I Got Bigger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IGotBigger): Comparing her models from Crisis Core Reunion and Final Fantasy VII Remake and her model with Aerith, who doesn’t have any height growth, it can be seen that Tifa grows nearly half a head taller between games.

[Iconic Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicOutfit): Tifa's original outfit from the original game, a white midriff sleeveless shirt and black leather [Mini Dress Of Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MiniDressOfPower), is very popular among the fandom ([for obvious reasons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice)) and is easily her most recognized getup. Her all-black *Advent Children* outfit is also popular.
[Leg Focus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LegFocus): Tifa's miniskirt shows off a lot of leg.
[Long Hair Is Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongHairIsFeminine): Her hair reaches down to her hips and is a very beautiful woman.
[Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear): To Marlene and Denzel. Threatening either of them will result in a brutal pounding into the floorboards.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Tifa *Lockhart* has a habit of keeping something locked away inside her heart like her feelings. *Tifa* alludes to Tifaret, the sixth sephiroth in the Kabbalah Tree of Life, which represents beauty, balance, and compassion and connects to all the other sephiroth except Malkuth. Aside from the obvious beauty, she's responsible for keeping Cloud in balance during his [Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD).
[Meteor Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeteorMove): Her Meteor Strike Limit Break has her lift a foe into the air and hurl them to the ground.

[Mini Dress Of Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MiniDressOfPower): Tifa's wearing a black leather mini-skirt and is the resident brawler. She ditches them for a regular-sized shorts in *Advent Children*.
[Missing Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingMom): Her mother died when Tifa was eight years old.

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): Short skirt, big boobs, long legs, Tifa ticks all the boxes and easily cements herself as one of the most popular sex symbols in all video games.
[Muscles Are Meaningless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MusclesAreMeaningless): Her arms are thin but her punches are powerful!
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): In spite of her profession and appearance, Tifa is a kind, gentle young woman who acts like a mother to Team AVALANCHE and is utterly devoted to Cloud.

[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed): Tifa's initial appearance really resembles [Jennifer Connelly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/JenniferConnelly), particularly her appearance on *[Career Opportunities](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/CareerOpportunities)* (compare [Tifa](https://static.tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pub/images/ff7_tifa_lockhart.png)◊ to [Connelly in that film](https://i.pinimg.com/736x/c5/66/01/c5660176c8e9e3bfdc97664047d5344f.jpg)◊). However, Tifa's appearance since *Advent Children* has been modeled after Ayumi Ito, [who is her Japanese voice actress since the film](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InkSuitActor).
[Power Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFist): Some of her gloves add claws or other attachments to make her blows stronger.

[Promotion to Parent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotionToParent): To Marlene and Denzel, although she could be viewed as more of a [Parental Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalSubstitute) to the former.
[Rapid-Fire Fisticuffs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapidFireFisticuffs): Beat Rush is a quick punch combo.
[Raven Hair, Ivory Skin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RavenHairIvorySkin): Dark haired and very pale skin, likely to show her status as a [Yamato Nadeshiko](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YamatoNadeshiko).

[Shorttank](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Shorttank): [Subverted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope). She may look like one given her outfit and nature as a brawler, but she's actually a sweet Girly Girl.
[Shoryuken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Shoryuken): Dolphin Blow is an uppercut with a blast of water.
[Shrinking Violet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShrinkingViolet): Can be very shy in regards to her feelings.

[Silk Hiding Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilkHidingSteel): More like 'Steel Hiding Silk' as she looks like a [Badass Biker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBiker), runs a bar, and fights with her bare hands, but inside she's more feminine than Aerith with her [Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress) fantasy with Cloud, her domestic skills, and role as [Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom) in the main group and AVALANCHE.

[Single Woman Seeks Good Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleWomanSeeksGoodMan): Tifa loves Cloud for the shy awkward [Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy) that he is, rather than the faux badass persona he displays through the early parts of the game (in fact it even scared her).
[Sleep Cute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleepCute): If her affection levels are high enough, Tifa and Cloud are seen cuddling next to each other under the Highwind upon morning.
[Sleeves Are for Wimps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleevesAreForWimps): All of Tifa's outfits are sleeveless and she's the resident [slobber knocker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareFistedMonk).
[The Smurfette Principle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmurfettePrinciple): If you don't get Yuffie, after Aerith dies Tifa is your only girl.

[Supreme Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupremeChef): Although it is an [Informed Attribute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InformedAttribute) since you never see her cook, characters comment that she's good at it and she's a bartender who owns the 7th Heaven bar.

[Sympathy for the Devil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SympathyForTheDevil): Not as much shown as her Remake self, but in this game she also broke Barret's ensuing fight with the Shinra Manager and bows apologetically to him afterwards. She also sympathizes with Cait Sith's reasons to stay in Shinra, assuming that he stayed there to keep the people of Midgar safe.

[Tamer and Chaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TamerAndChaster): Her attire in *Advent Children* covers more of her stomach and legs, but still leaves parts of them visible. The remake version of her initial outfit was also tweaked to have [Modesty Shorts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ModestyShorts), a sports bra, and stockings.
[Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom): To AVALANCHE. The home base chef who worries about them.
[Third-Person Seductress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThirdPersonSeductress): Very curvy and shapely, wears skimpy clothing, and beats up enemies with her bare hands.

[Tomboy and Girly Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomboyAndGirlyGirl): Seems to be a Tomboy yet plays the Girly Girl to Aerith's Tomboy. [Rare spin of traditional character design.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope) [The two have since swapped roles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flanderization) for the expanded universe and spin-offs — Tifa isn't a traditional tomboy, but is still depicted as much more of one than Aerith is now, who in turn is more girly. [The Remake continuity gives their original characterization back.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterRerailment)

[Tritagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tritagonist): In *Final Fantasy 7*. While Cloud is the protagonist due to being the character with the most focus and development while Aerith is the deuteragonist due to her connection to the Lifestream and being pivotal to saving the Planet, Tifa’s connection to Cloud ever since childhood and her relationship with him is key to the story as she is the only living person who knows the truth about what Cloud did in Nibelheim and ends up saving him from his breakdown by entering his mind and making him realize the truth.
[True Blue Femininity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueBlueFemininity): As a member of Don Corneo's brothel, Tifa is seen wearing a dark blue cocktail dress.
[Trying Not to Cry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TryingNotToCry): After gently caressing Aerith's lifeless body, Tifa eventually breaks down and runs away crying.

[Unwanted Harem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwantedHarem): [Gender inverted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderInvertedTrope) version. Tifa was very popular with the guys, Cloud included, in Nibelheim, but she wasn't romantically interested in any of them (except for Cloud).

[Water Is Womanly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaterIsWomanly): Tifa is associated with water. She has a dolphin-themed hairstyle, uses water-themed attacks with Waterkick and Dolphin Blow as her Limit Breaks, and is a bartender who pours drinks. In spite of her tomboyish appearance, she's a kind, giving woman who acts as the [Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom) and is devoted to Cloud.
[Wolverine Claws](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WolverineClaws): Several of her weapons have three claws attached to the back.
[Wrestler in All of Us](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrestlerInAllOfUs): Her Meteordive [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) is a vertical suplex to brainbuster combo.

[Yamato Nadeshiko](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YamatoNadeshiko): Let's see here, devotion to the man she loves, check. Classically feminine like being gentle, demure, [Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom), and having good domestic skill, check. Iron heart that is strong enough to temporarily become [The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader) and accompany [The Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHero) out of his [Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD), check please. She has everything except a connection to [Wutai/Japan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasyCounterpartCulture) and the attached cultural trappings.

tropeName: Absence Makes the Heart Go Yonder
tropeNotes: [Absence Makes the Heart Go Yonder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbsenceMakesTheHeartGoYonder): After Zack has been missing for four years, Aerith has mostly moved on from him; however there are some hints that she was never as over her [First Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FirstLove) as she would like.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): She's pretty hands on for a [White Magician Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMagicianGirl).
[Ancient Artifact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AncientArtifact): The White Materia her mother gave her, which makes her the only person able to cast [Holy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HolyHandGrenade).

tropeName: Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence
tropeNotes: [Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendToAHigherPlaneOfExistence): In a way. When she died, her spirit returned to the Lifestream, but she was powerful enough to remain sentient within it. This allows her to command it when necessary, and help lost souls find atonement and peace.

[Awesome Anachronistic Apparel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwesomeAnachronisticApparel): The shoulder pads of her red jacket reeks of [80s](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEighties) culture on a popular late 90s game but it didn't stop it from being an [Iconic Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicOutfit). The shoulder pads are retconned out in later releases, however.

[Backup from Otherworld](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackupFromOtherworld): Stops Meteor as part of the Lifestream during the closing moments of the original game. In *Advent Children*, her spirit also helps Cloud in the battle against Bahamut SIN by joining in the [Fastball Special](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FastballSpecial). She later uses her Great Gospel [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) from beyond the grave in order to cleanse Midgard and Edge of Geostigma.

[Big Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood): She arguably evolves into this role posthumously near the end of the original game, and *definitely* plays this in *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren).* Being so powerful she can command the Lifestream to help protect the planet, the other heroes view her as watching over them and helping them from afar.

[Braids of Action](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BraidsOfAction): Bouts of being the [Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress) aside, Aerith lives by the [Big Damn Heroes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigDamnHeroes) trope and is no stranger to combat.
[The Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCameo): An alternate version of her appears in *[Final Fantasy Tactics](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyTactics)*.
[Colour Coded Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColourCodedEyes): Her green eyes symbolize her spiritual nature and powerful bond with the planet.

[Crutch Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrutchCharacter): Her [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) are [Purposely Overpowered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PurposelyOverpowered) for when you get them to compensate for her only being around for part of the game, starting strong with a multi-target heal, status removal, priming the other party member's Limit Breaks, invincibility (which [can't be replicated](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProtagonistPowerUpPrivileges) by any other party member even with materia), a full HP/MP restore, and lastly invincibility *[and](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreadEggsBreadedEggs)* a full HP/MP restore. Her Ultimate Weapon is also the only one that has "Normal" materia growth instead of [the no growth everyone else gets,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NecessaryDrawback) and naturally you get it [a lot earlier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneNuke) than anyone else's Ultimate. Of course, this just makes losing her by the end of disc 1 that much more painful if you've come to rely on her too much by then.

[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): A bit pluckier than the norm, although there's still a whole level dedicated to rescuing her. Not to mention at the beginning of the game, when you have to save her from Shinra soldiers by crushing them with barrels (although you do have the option of making her fight them herself).
[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove): How she (in)famously dies, via a surprise stabbing by a descending Sephiroth.

[Death of the Hypotenuse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathOfTheHypotenuse): The game's somewhat infamous love triangle comes to a crashing close when one of the two ladies involved gets a sword through the gut.

[Decoy Protagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DecoyProtagonist): She's the very first main character introduced and while Cloud (along with Barrett) was immediately introduced and established as [The Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHero), the plot still hinges on Aerith being the last of the Ancients who could stop Sephiroth's [Evil Plan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilPlan), seemingly making her the co-protagonist of sorts. She was fatally stabbed by Sephiroth at the end of Disc 1.

[Deuteragonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Deuteragonist): The plot revolves around Aerith being the last of the Ancients as much as it revolves around Cloud as she is the only person capable of summoning Holy and with her death she ends up becoming one with the Lifestream, which ends up saving the Planet from Meteor.

[Doomed by Canon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedByCanon): Contrary to all rumors of ways to save her or revive her, when the credits roll at the original game's end, Aerith will not be there to see it.

[Doomed Moral Victor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedMoralVictor): She succeeded in calling Holy and giving the planet the chance to save itself from Meteor, but it attracted Sephiroth's notice and cost her her life.
[Dropped a Bridge on Him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DroppedABridgeOnHim): A major reason why her death is so remembered is due to how abrupt it happened.

[Early-Bird Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarlyBirdCameo): She appears in two separate scenes (the game's opening scene in which she's actually the very first character seen, then after the bombing mission where Cloud could buy flowers from her) before her formal introduction.

[Fire/Water Juxtaposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireWaterJuxtaposition): As part of her [Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart) dichotomy with Sephiroth, Aerith is associated with water via Great Gospel and the Lifestream, contrasting Sephiroth's fire associations via the Nibelheim Incident and his Supernova attack.

[Flanderization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flanderization): In her original game, Aerith was pure hearted, spiritual and caring, but was also stubborn, flirty, independent and witty. However, SE has ramped up the [Incorruptible Pure Pureness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncorruptiblePurePureness), emphasizing her connection to the planet and de-emphasizing her more headstrong character traits in favor of generic sweetness and innocence. Her *Dissidia 012* Ultimania profile describes her as having "[the innocence of a little girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheIngenue)". This is the same woman that threatened to *[rip off](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianThreat)* a mafia don's balls.
[Four Is Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourIsDeath): Aerith is the fourth playable main character and is the game's major [Character Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDeath).
[Hairstyle Inertia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairstyleInertia): Aerith is seen sporting the exact same hairstyle as a child.
[Half-Human Hybrid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HalfHumanHybrid): Her father was a normal human while her mother was a Cetra, but this has little bearing on her status as an Ancient.

[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): By Elmyra, who actually finds little!Aerith by the side of her dying mother Ifalna in the local train station, and takes her in to fulfill Ifalna's dying wish.

[Hartman Hips](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HartmanHips): Her bust is nowhere near as large as Tifa's, however, Aerith still has [her](http://images4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110227161509/finalfantasy/images/9/93/Aeris-FFVIIArt.png)◊ [womanly](http://images3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110224134016/finalfantasy/images/3/37/Aerith-DissidiaAlt1.png)◊ [attributes](http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110224033548/finalfantasy/images/9/9f/Itadaki-Aerith2.png)◊.
[Healing Hands](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingHands): Her Healing Wind, Pulse of Life and Great Gospel Limit Breaks all restore HP to the party.
[Her Heart Will Go On](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HerHeartWillGoOn): Following Zack's disappearance she remained loyal to his memory for a time, but eventually moved on with her life.
