[Iconic Item](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicItem): In every appearance, even in concept art, Aerith has her hair ribbon. *Crisis Core* takes time to specifically show where she got it and why she continues to wear one years later. The White Materia also serves as one to a lesser degree.
[Iconic Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicOutfit): Aerith's pink dress, red jacket, golden bracelets, and red ribbon getup is easily recognizable among the fandom.
[Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice): She meets her end when Sephiroth stabs the Masamune through her stomach.
[Inconsistent Spelling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InconsistentSpelling): The original English translation had her name as "Aeris."

[Incorruptible Pure Pureness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncorruptiblePurePureness): Compared to most other party members, Aerith doesn't have many character flaws, being good-hearted and noble from start to finish. All that change is she comes to terms with her heritage and embraces the legacy she's been left.

[Innocent Flower Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InnocentFlowerGirl): But not *too* innocent. In the Wall Market section, she selects what is implied to be an incredibly provocative red dress for herself, and it's her idea in the first place to have Cloud dress in drag to get into Don Corneo's mansion. She seems to actually *want* Don Corneo to pick her as his girl, complimenting him on his taste if he does. In contrast to Tifa and Cloud who are just doing it for the mission, Aerith has no qualms at all and evidently finds the whole thing fun, irrespective of the threat.
[In the Back](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InTheBack): Sephiroth [impales](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice) her this way, jumping from above then stabbing her upon landing.

[I Will Wait for You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWillWaitForYou): Subverted, she told this to Zack in their last phone conversation, but not knowing what happened to him after four years with no word, she said she was moving on in her last letter.
[Kill the Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillTheCutie): The sweetest and most loving party member is the one among them who dies.
[Lady in Red](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyInRed): While infiltrating Don Corneo's brothel to rescue Tifa, Aerith goes for a red [Pimped-Out Dress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PimpedOutDress).

[The Lancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLancer): Early on, her selfless and spiritual nature contrasts Cloud's [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold) ex-SOLDIER. Later on her growing acceptance of her Cetra heritage make her a foil to Cloud's rising doubts over his identity.
[Last of His Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastOfHisKind): Aerith is the last known Ancient in the entire world.
[Little Dead Riding Hood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittleDeadRidingHood): She's the only party member aside from Cait Sith to wear red, marking her for death.

[Loving a Shadow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LovingAShadow): Initially interested in Cloud because of his resemblance to Zack, her first boyfriend. And that they both [fell through the church roof](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeetCute) while she was tending the flowers and wearing the same uniform. However, getting her on the date scene will have her admit that she would like for Cloud to open up to her so she can know the [real him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foreshadowing).

[Magical Native American](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicalNativeAmerican): Her Cetra heritage gives her an innate connection to the planet and makes her more inclined to use magic than normal humans. In addition, her people used to be wandering nomads seeking "the Promised Land".
[Magic Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicStaff): She fights with various rods and staves.

[Manic Pixie Dream Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManicPixieDreamGirl): The spin-offs almost turn her into a [Cloudcuckoolander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Cloudcuckoolander), what with her comments that she's afraid of the open sky and she can hear the wind calling her name. Let's not forget that *she* was the one who suggested Cloud [cross-dress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WholesomeCrossdresser) [to save Tifa...](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItMakesSenseInContext)

[Martial Arts Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MartialArtsStaff): Half of Aerith's weapons aren't actually [Magic Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicStaff) but she uses them as such nonetheless. Specifically, Guard Stick (her starting weapon), Mythril Rod, Full Metal Staff, Striking Staff, and Aurora Rod are all clearly designed for combat or/and self-defense ([as some of the names clearly indicate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin)).

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Aerith's name was created to resemble and sound like the English word Earth referencing her connection to the planet as well as adding contrast to the sky based name Cloud.

[Messianic Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MessianicArchetype): The last of her kind, born of a union between a human and another race, spiritually enlightened, becomes a willing martyr and dies to save the planet.
[My Girl Back Home](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGirlBackHome): She's the only reason Zack decided to return to Midgar.
[Mystical Waif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysticalWaif): This young girl is the guardian of Holy, the ultimate protective magic that can save the planet.
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Aerith might not be innocent by any means, but she has a heart of pure gold and actively looks out for other people’s best interests.

[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed): Aerith's [appearance](http://images.wikia.com/finalfantasy/images/e/e4/Aeris_Portrait.jpg)◊ resembles (and is said to be modeled after) a [young](https://www.sitcomsonline.com/photopost/data/626/brookyoung.jpg)◊ [Brooke Shields](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/BrookeShields). Coincidentally or not, Aerith was laid to rest in a [blue lagoon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheBlueLagoon1980).
[The Paralyzer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheParalyzer): Seal Evil silences and paralyzes enemies

[Parasol of Pain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParasolOfPain): Stat wise it is her strongest weapon, which could be obtained if a player scores at least 5000 points at Gold Saucer's Speed Square. However as it does not have materia attachments and Aerith is a mage class character, it's more or less a joke weapon.
[Pietà Plagiarism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PietaPlagiarism): Her lifeless body was cradled by Cloud this way. She was laid to rest by him laying her corpse in the Forbidden City lake.
[Pink Means Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PinkMeansFeminine): Her pink dress, and many of her outfits in spin-offs, are pink.
[Plotline Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlotlineDeath): The infamous FMV sequence of Sephiroth stabbing her. In turn has led to jokes asking why Cloud didn't try a Phoenix Down.
[Plucky Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyGirl): She's spirited and playful and never backs down from anyone.
[The Pollyanna](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePollyanna): Despite how awful and traumatic her life has been, Aerith remains happy and well-adjusted.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): In *Advent Children*, she's more or less just a [Spirit Advisor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpiritAdvisor) for Cloud.

[Present Absence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PresentAbsence): Aerith's death weighs heavily on the characters. Her murder at Sephiroth's hands becomes their resolve to continue stopping his [Evil Plan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilPlan) as he made it (even more) personal. In *Advent Children*, Cloud is still visibly mourning her death along with Zack's. The game also enforces this to the player, as her usual slot in the party menu screen remains empty for the duration of the game.

[Raised in a Lab](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RaisedInALab): Aerith, along with her mother, was one of [Professor Hojo's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist) test subjects in the Shinra labs as a child. Little is told of her time there, just that her mother was killed when they escaped when she was seven, and her father died trying to prevent Shinra from taking them when she wasn't even a month old. What we see of Hojo and her experience when she's briefly recaptured gives just enough hints to let players [fill in the gaps themselves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NothingIsScarier).
[Red Herring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedHerring): Aerith is presented as a possible love interest on the first disk to make her death hit that much harder.
[Red Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedIsHeroic): Wears a red jacket and red ribbon and is undoubtedly one of the good guys.

[Reused Character Design](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReusedCharacterDesign): She bears a very strong resemblance to the Lemure, an enemy from *[Final Fantasy V](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyV)* that was also designed by Nomura.
[Sacrificial Lion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SacrificialLion): Her death sends shockwaves through the party and the fanbase alike, and is a warning Sephiroth is done playing around with you.
[Second Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecondLove): Cloud, as her first love was Zack.

[Silk Hiding Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilkHidingSteel): A sweet and lovely lady who recruits Cloud to be her bodyguard. As the last Cetra, she's also the only one who can call out the Holy spell, which can stop the [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad)'s [Colony Drop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonyDrop).

[Single Woman Seeks Good Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleWomanSeeksGoodMan): She was in love with Zach Fair in *Crisis Core* for his bravery and selflessness. The two were in a relationship for a while until his death. She also starts to genuinely fall for Cloud because of his innate goodness, and tells him in their date that she wants to meet the real him, knowing that the cold persona he shows does not reflect the kind-hearted soul he really is deep inside.

[Sneaky Departure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SneakyDeparture): She leaves the party to head to the Forgotten City while Cloud is unconscious. Early in the game she defies it; when Cloud tries to pull this trope on her while staying at her home, she slips out herself and intercepts him, demanding to come along.
[Spirit Advisor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpiritAdvisor): To Cloud in *Advent Children*.
[Squishy Wizard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquishyWizard): The most powerful magically but can't take a hit well.
[Status Buff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusBuff): Her Limit Break Fury Brand [inflicts Fury status](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CursedWithAwesome) on her allies and and fills their Limit Bars.
[Street Smart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StreetSmart): "I was raised in the slums. I'm used to danger."
[Summoning Artifact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummoningArtifact): It's emphasized that with how humanity has turned out, Holy might save the planet but kill off mankind too.

[Sympathy for the Devil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SympathyForTheDevil): In the Forgotten Capital, she cries for Tseng before resuming her journey, as he's one of the few people who knew her since little.
[The Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTease): She's rather flirtatious and open with her interest in Cloud.

[Together in Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TogetherInDeath): She and Zack are reunited in the Lifestream after *Advent Children*, though it's implied that it won't last for long as most people's consciousness will dissolve into the Lifestream after death, with Aerith being an exception because of her innate powers as a Cetra.

[Tomboy and Girly Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomboyAndGirlyGirl): Has the definitive attitude of a tomboy, [sharply contrasting her appearance, personality, hobbies, weapon, and limits](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope).

tropeName: Too Good for This Sinful Earth
tropeNotes: [Too Good for This Sinful Earth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooGoodForThisSinfulEarth): Cheerful and loving, all the party adores her, and one of those that doesn't have any shade of [Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero) in a [Crapsack World](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrapsackWorld). Yeah, she was doomed from the start.

[Water Is Womanly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaterIsWomanly): Aerith is a compassionate healer who wears a pink dress and is associated with rain and water in *Advent Children*, even creating a healing pool for those inflicted with geostigma. She is also heavily associated with the lifestream, which flows like water. Aerith was also laid to rest in a lake in front of the Forgotten City. Nojima even in stated in the *Advent Children -Reunion Files-* that "Aerith has sort of a 'watery' image about her, so [the staff] used water to convey her presence".

[White Magician Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMagicianGirl): Her personal skills involve healing. Although with the Materia system, she easily becomes a [Red Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedMage).

[Yamato Nadeshiko](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YamatoNadeshiko): She has some traits but is more rebellious and flirty than the standard. Nor does she have the cultural baggage assiociated with [Wutai/Japan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasyCounterPartCulture). OTOH, she plays the trope straighter in *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren)*.

[13 Is Unlucky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThirteenIsUnlucky): Until he befriends [Cloud and the others](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions), his life is one of misery. The branding of "XIII" marked his capture by Shinra when things got even worse.
[The Artifact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheArtifact): He is still addressed as "Red XIII" by the party long after they learn of his real name being Nanaki.

[Cartoon Creature](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CartoonCreature): The series never assigns a name to Red's species, which combines various feline and canine traits. Characters occasionally refer to him as lion-like, but his association with the moon and howling to express himself is more like a wolf.
[Combat Haircomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatHaircomb): His weapons are various hair clips, combs, and headdresses.

[Comic-Book Fantasy Casting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicBookFantasyCasting): Although he obviously wasn't meant to *look* like him, Tetsuya Nomura imagined that Red XIII would be voiced by [Sean Connery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/SeanConnery). When he had a spoken line in *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren)*, it was done as an imitation of Sean Connery.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): He appears considerably less in *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren)* than the other characters, and is only seen at the very last cutscene in *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*. According to the makers, this is because his fur is a pain to animate well.
[Handicapped Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandicappedBadass): Red is missing his right eye but still fights for the world alongside the rest of the party.
[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): He views Bugenhagen as his grandfather, since he raised him after Red's real parents were gone.

[Howl of Sorrow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HowlOfSorrow): Gave one after finding out [what](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) [really](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakenForGranite) [happened](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AndIMustScream) to his father Seto, whom Red wrongly believed a [Dirty Coward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DirtyCoward). If you bring him on Forbidden City at the end of Disc 1, he'll also give one to Aerith.
[Incendiary Exponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncendiaryExponent): His tail is constantly alight with a flame on the tip.
[Intellectual Animal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntellectualAnimal): He is very wise and intelligent, more than most of the human characters in the game actually.
[Interspecies Adoption](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterspeciesAdoption): The very anima-like Nanaki was raised by the very human Bugenhagen.
[Jack of All Stats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JackOfAllStats): He's fast and good with both physical and magical attacks, and has decent HP.
[Life Drain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LifeDrain): Blood Fang absorbs HP and MP from enemies.
[Light 'em Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightEmUp): Stardust Ray bombards enemies with stars of light.

[Magical Native American](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicalNativeAmerican): His people are fire-tailed, talking red mountain lion who lives for centuries as the ending cinematic shows. Their [role](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlanetOfHats) is safeguarding Cosmo Canyon, the holy ground of the Study of Planet Life. The Cosmo Canyon has an [overtly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheThemeParkVersion) Native American theme. His weapons of choice are 'combs', feathers that adorn the headdress of a Native chief.

[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed): In *[Advent Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/FinalFantasyVIIAdventChildren)*, he was meant to sound like [Sean Connery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/SeanConnery).

[Parental Abandonment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalAbandonment): His mother [died protecting Cosmo Canyon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingMom), and he believed his father [left her alone to die](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad) [because he was afraid of fighting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoureNotMyFather). Turns out he didn't run away but went fighting the monsters that were attacking from behind; he won but was [petrified](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakenForGranite). And he is still [alive and conscious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AndIMustScream).

[Punny Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunnyName): M is the thirteenth letter in the English alphabet and Nanaki is the designated [Red Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRedMage). The "Nana" in his name also means [seven](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArcNumber) in Japanese.

[Red Herring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedHerring): When the group notes the Sephiroth Clones have numbers tattooed on them, Red begins to worry if his number "XIII" means he's one as well and if he'll also begin to lose his mind. But he doesn't, and [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) says he wasn't a member of the Sephiroth Clone project, the number was assigned to him for a different reason.
[Red Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedIsHeroic): Has red fur, [is actually named Red](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin) and is one of the good guys.
[The Red Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRedMage): Red has decent attack and magic stats but not on the same level as the characters specifically designed for them.
[Status Buff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusBuff): Lunatic High and Howling Moon grant status buffs on him and/or his allies.
[Talking Animal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalkingAnimal): His ability to talk stands out to the party and freaks them out when he reveals it.
[Teen Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeenGenius): Despite being a teenager by his species' standards, he's the wisest and most intelligent member of the party.

[Token Non-Human](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenNonHuman): He and Cait Sith share the role as the obvious non-humanoid party members. Nanaki is a canine/feline hybrid creature while Cait Sith is the [Robot Buddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RobotBuddy).
[Wave-Motion Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaveMotionGun): His ultimate Limit Break, Cosmos Memory, blasts enemies with a giant beam of orange energy.
["X" Marks the Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/XMarksTheHero): Nanaki is one of the main characters and he has an x-shaped scar in place of his missing right eye.
[You Are in Command Now](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreInCommandNow): He becomes the leader of Cosmo Canyon after his grandfather's death.

[You Are Number 6](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreNumberSix): Hojo tattooed "XIII" on his leg to mark him as one of his experiments. Red tells the party when he joins them that "Red XIII" is a name that holds no meaning to him, and they can call him that or anything else as they wish.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Not quite as much as Tifa, but she can still kick some serious ass.
[Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero): She's cheerful and helps the party save the world, but initially joins them for selfish reasons and is overall can be quite a brat at times.

[Art Attacker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtAttacker): Two of her weapons are a pinwheel ([the Pinwheel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin)) and an origami ([the Oritsuru](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaperMaster)).
[The Baby of the Bunch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBabyOfTheBunch): The youngest member of the group (16 in the original game), and her immaturity frequently shows.
[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): She's a skilled ninja and can fight monsters many times her sizes, and looks so cute while doing it.

[Battle Boomerang](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleBoomerang): Yuffie's first weapon upgrade is [Exactly What It Says on the Tin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin). It could be stolen from a Formula monster or buying it from either Junon or Gongaga weapon shops.

[Boyish Short Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoyishShortHair): Contrasting [Tifa and Aerith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongHairIsFeminine), Yuffie has a rather short hairstyle. This justified, though, considering she's a [Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ninja).
[Bratty Half-Pint](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrattyHalfPint): In the original game, she can be very loud-mouthed and rude.

[Combat Hand Fan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatHandFan): Wind Slash, which doubles her materia's AP gains. It could be found on a chest on the cargo ship bound to Costa del Sol after defeating Jenova BIRTH or bought from Junon's weapon shop.

[Cry into Chest](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CryIntoChest): Yuffie, [unable to keep it all together](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TryingNotToCry) after Aerith gets murdered by Sephiroth, breaks down sobbing in Cloud's arms.
[Defeat Means Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansPlayable): Yuffie is the only playable character required to be defeated first in order to be recruited.

[Diagonal Cut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiagonalCut): Greased Lightning slashes the enemy diagonally and it takes a few seconds before they notice and take damage. They don't actually slide apart though, since it may not always be a fatal attack.
[Dishing Out Dirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DishingOutDirt): Landscaper manifests as her sending a shockwave through the dirt to make the ground underneath the enemy party erupt.
[Fragile Speedster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FragileSpeedster): Yuffie's very fast, but when she gets hit, it hurts.
[Fuuma Shuriken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FuumaShuriken): Her weapon is a giant shuriken.
[Genki Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenkiGirl): Is almost eternally energetic, cheerful, and upbeat.
[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): Whether throwing her boomerangs or using materia, Yuffie's very good at damaging the enemies. It's when they hit her back that she has problems.
[Guest Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestFighter): In *[Ehrgeiz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/Ehrgeiz)*.
[Healing Hands](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingHands): Clear Tranquil heals the party's HP.
[Heir to the Dojo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeirToTheDojo): She's the daughter of the leader of Wutai and his heir to the legacy of ninja the nation prides itself on.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths):
    - She is one of the characters who Cloud can date on the [Romance Sidequest](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RomanceSidequest), and while not as tender as Tifa or Aerith is rather sweet, and is the only one of the three to kiss him. She also lays into Cait Sith a lot more than the other women when she finds out he's holding Marlene hostage. - The reason she's obsessed with Materia? She wants the power it holds because she's disgusted with how Wutai went from a respected ninja civilization to a tourist attraction after Shinra conquered it, and wants Materia in the hopes of changing things and maybe restoring some dignity to the town.

[Iconic Starter Equipment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicStarterEquipment): Her Juji Shuriken (or 4-Point Shuriken) is her default in the original game, *[Dirge Of Cerberus Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberusFinalFantasyVII)* and *[Final Fantasy VII Remake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIIRemake)*. It also appears in the official artwork for her and is what she uses in *[Kingdom Hearts II](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/KingdomHeartsII)* and her weapon in her Play Arts model figures.

[Inelegant Blubbering](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InelegantBlubbering): If you bring her to the Forbidden City, Yuffie will at first [try to act calm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TryingNotToCry) after Aerith was killed and even gives her a prayer. Immediately she begins to shiver and then completely breaks down afterwards.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): As bratty as Yuffie acts, she has a good sense of morals deep down and wants to do the right thing.
[Light 'em Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightEmUp): Gauntlet blasts enemies with a column of light from below.
[Loveable Rogue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveableRogue): She's out to steal the party's Materia, but has sympathetic reasons for it and manages to be likable in the meantime.

[Male Gaze](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze): She in her OG [FF7](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyII) [outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TankTopTomboy) is subjected to this in the *opening sequence* of *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*.
[Martial Arts Headband](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MartialArtsHeadband): She's wearing a white one in the original game, being from a [Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ninja) clan and all.
[Ninja](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ninja): Raised in a society of them and is one herself. She wields traditional ninja tools.
[Ninja Brat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NinjaBrat): She's only 16 during the original game.

[Not Me This Time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotMeThisTime): There's a variation on this during the Wutai sequence. As the party approaches Wutai, they are confronted by a group of Shinra soldiers. Yuffie comments, "I have nothing to do with this one!" As they had already been suspicious (but didn't yet know that she had done anything), this clues them in when, during the battle with the soldiers, she's gone and so is all their materia.

[Optional Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalPartyMember): You can skip recruiting her, but she still has a lot to do in the storyline. This is because the character designers liked her and salvaged a lot of the planned content for her when she and Vincent were moved from mandatory to optional due to time constraints.

[Paper Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaperMaster): Her second most powerful weapon, the Oritsuru, is a paper crane. It could be obtained once the player puts out the flame at the Da-chao statue using Leviathan Scale.
[Plucky Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyGirl): Energetic and spirited and always ready to fight for Wutai.
[The Prankster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePrankster): She's constantly scheming ways to trick the party out of their Materia, and then to evade them when they chase her to Wutai.
[Rebellious Princess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelliousPrincess): Her dad's the lord of Wutai, and he's not at all happy that she ran away from home.

[Rings of Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RingsOfDeath): She had a few of these in addition to her typical arsenal of [shurikens](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FuumaShuriken) and [boomerangs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleBoomerang). [Razor Ring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin) is a straight up example. Rising Sun combines it with [Chainsaw Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainsawGood). Yuffie's ultimate weapon, the Conformer, combines it with her usual [Fuuma Shuriken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FuumaShuriken).

[Rummage Sale Reject](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RummageSaleReject): Most of her clothes would look less out of place in a junkyard. Perhaps not surprising, considering she's a free-spirited [Lovable Rogue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LovableRogue) who probably doesn't have the money or desire to dress fashionably.
[Running Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RunningGag): Her motion sickness is brought up whenever you're on a vehicle.

[The Scapegoat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheScapegoat): In her episode of *On The Way To A Smile*, she gets blamed for the Geostigma epidemic in Wutai because she was at Midgar during her journey.  (SPOILER) It's later revealed that it was her childhood friend who brought the illness because he went to Midgar on his own in attempt to help his mother.

[Ship Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease):
    - Out of all the characters you can choose to take on a date to the Gold Saucer, she is the only character who kisses Cloud. - With Vincent in *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*, especially when Vincent seemingly dies taking out Omega. Whether it's because she likes him or is simply concerned because he's a comrade is still open to debate.

[Small Name, Big Ego](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallNameBigEgo): She's prone to giving herself grandiose titles and treating herself like a legendary ninja hero. She may be skilled but she's not as great or famed as she pretends.

tropeName: So Long, and Thanks for All the Gear
tropeNotes: [So Long, and Thanks for All the Gear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoLongAndThanksForAllTheGear): "Wutai Theft" is the former [Trope Namer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TropeNamer), though she doesn't fit the actual trope definition. At one point Yuffie swipes all the party's Materia and takes off with it, and you have to track her down and get it back.
[Spam Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpamAttack): Bloodfest and Doom of the Living consist of her rapidly hitting enemies with her weapon over and over.
[Sticky Fingers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StickyFingers): She is absolutely obsessed with getting her hands on Materia, no matter the cost.

[Tank-Top Tomboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TankTopTomboy): She dresses in this due to her as a ninja. Because of that she gets a *brief* moment of [sexualization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze) in the *opening cutscene* of *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)* (although its due to the camera's [close up view of her](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze)).
[Tomboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tomboy): She dresses boyishly, has short hair, prone to boasting of her skill as a great ninja, yes, she fits. She is also described as such in the FF7 Ultimania.

[Trying Not to Cry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TryingNotToCry): Attempts to do this but ultimately fails after Aerith's death. After paying her respects, she turns to look at Cloud, her character model slowly becoming more and more agitated, her emotions becoming too much for her to handle, and she suddenly jumps in Cloud's arms, overwhelmed by grief. She tries to calm down afterwards, but ends up running away, crying.
[Wave-Motion Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaveMotionGun): Her ultimate [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) All Creation is a giant purple ray of energy.

[Weaponized Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeaponizedBall): Her joke weapon is a yellow one called Superball. It could be obtained by winning the seventh Fort Condor battle or buying it from the Junon weapon shop.
[Welcome Back, Traitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WelcomeBackTraitor): After the team talks her down and finds out why she stole their Materia, they let her back in the group.

[Yamato Nadeshiko](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YamatoNadeshiko): Averted. She's the only one who has a connection to Wutai, yet she is neither polite, domestic, interested in its culture, nor family oriented.

[Ambiguous Robots](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousRobots): The series flip-flops between Cait Sith being a stuffed toy, a robot with fur, or a combination of both. It's likewise not clear how much autonomy he has, if any.
    - In Dirge of Cerberus, we see Cait Sith and Reeve in the same room together moving independently. Between the two, Vincent chooses to face and talk to Cait Sith, but refers to him as Reeve. In another cutscene, Cid refers to Cait but immediately corrects himself with Reeve, creating an interesting scenario where we even though see that Cait Sith seems to have autonomy, he's not treated as his own person.
[Cat Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatGirl): The "Lucky Girl" limit break is a picture of a cat girl in a [Fur Bikini](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FurBikini).

[Cats Are Mean](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatsAreMean): Double subverted. He has a very cheery personality but is an extreme [Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkAss) in the beginning. Later, it's completely subverted.

[Creepy Jazz Music](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreepyJazzMusic): He has a catchy jazz organ tune as his [leitmotif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Leitmotif), which fits both his status as [The Gambler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGambler) and his being a bit of a [Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass).
[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove): His Toy Box Limit Break drops a random object on enemies to crush them, including [meteors](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonyDrop).

[Death or Glory Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathOrGloryAttack): Attempting to get Game Over in Slots can result in a [Total Party Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TotalPartyKill) on either side depending on whether it's done correctly or you mess up on the third slot, casting Death Joker instead.

[The Dividual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDividual): Officially the Cait Sith character is the robotic cat, but his giant nameless Moogle is always with him serving as his means of moving that it's essentially the character too. There's also the Reeve factor.

[Early-Bird Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarlyBirdCameo): A toy version of him could be spotted if the player enters Honey Bee Inn and peeks at one of the rooms in the right during Cloud's [Disguised in Drag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisguisedInDrag) sidequest to infiltrate Don Corneo's mansion. The actual character doesn't appear until the first visit to Gold Saucer.

[Expendable Clone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpendableClone): Reeve is implied to have several Cait Sith robots on standby for usage if one is lost or damaged. We see two in *VII*, and in *Dirge of Cerberus* one introduces itself as "Number 6".
[The Gambler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGambler): His Limit Breaks are themed after dice and slot machines, and you recruit him in the Gold Saucer, a hot tourist spot.
[Head Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeadPet): He rides on the head of his Moogle toy.
[Healing Hands](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingHands): [Mog Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicDance).
[Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn): Goes from being a mouthy Shinra-supporting [Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkAss) to a good guy who pulls his weight to save the planet.
[Instrument of Murder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstrumentOfMurder): Few of Cait Sith's arsenals are trumpets (e.g Trumpet Shell and Battle Trumpet).

[Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass): He eventually gets his [heart of gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold). And then loses the [Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass) part almost entirely.
[Luck-Based Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckBasedMission): His Slots and Dice both do random things.
[Make My Monster Grow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakeMyMonsterGrow): Transform turns his Moogle toy giant.

[The Mole](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMole): Cait Sith is actually controlled by Reeve of Shinra, but still [decides to remain with you](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMole) once discovered. The trope is later inverted when he essentially becomes a spy for AVALANCHE within Shinra, despite starting the other way around.
[One-Hit KO](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKO): Game Over kills all enemies, bypassing death protection.

[Ooh, Me Accent's Slipping](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OohMeAccentsSlipping): This was how Reeve is exposed in the Japanese version of the game. Reeve speaks with a Kanto dialect and Cait Sith with a Kansai dialect. When stressed due to Hojo taking over the Mako Cannon, Reeve inadvertently speaks to Scarlet and Heidegger in Kansai, then Cait Sith speaks to Cloud and the others in Kanto. Thus they realize that he's Reeve.

[Randomized Damage Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RandomizedDamageAttack): Cait Sith's Dice [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), which rolls several dice and then inflicts damage equal to the result multiplied by 20 to one enemy.

[Redeeming Replacement](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedeemingReplacement): Thanks to his [Expendable Clone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExpendableClone) nature. The first Cait Sith who joins the party is a spy for Shinra. The second one is a genuine ally through and through.

[Religious and Mythological Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReligiousAndMythologicalThemeNaming): ["Cat-sith"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cat-s<!--C3-->ACth) is a creature from [Celtic Mythology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Myth/CelticMythology).
[Ridiculously Cute Critter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RidiculouslyCuteCritter): He's an anthropomorphic cat that rides on a Moogle. It's hard to get cuter than that.
[Robot Buddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RobotBuddy): Both the anthropomorphic cat and the Moogle are mechanical.
[Squishy Wizard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquishyWizard): He has high magic stats, but his defenses and HP are poor.
[Status Buff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusBuff): Lucky Girl makes all the party's attacks critical hits.
[Team Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamPet): Probably the only one who has their *own* [Team Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamPet) (his giant moogle).

[Token Good Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate): Prior to his [Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn) was the only executive who actually gave a rat's ass about the common people.

[Token Non-Human](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenNonHuman): He and Red XIII share the role as the obvious non-humanoid party members. Cait Sith is the [Robot Buddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RobotBuddy) while Nanaki is a canine/feline hybrid creature.
[Total Party Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TotalPartyKill): Death Joker, often the result of a failed attempt at Game Over. Bypasses death protection too.

[Welcome Back, Traitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WelcomeBackTraitor): When they initially find out what he really is, they initially keep him around because Reeve is holding Marlene hostage. Shortly after he performs a [Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) at the Temple of the Ancients to get them the Black Materia, earning their trust for real.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): Calls out Barret for his bombing missions from earlier in the game. It comes off as somewhat hypocritical, however, since he's... y'know, with the Shinra, but Reeve was never crazy about the killing of innocents to begin with.

[11th-Hour Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EleventhHourSuperpower): Though Chaos is Vincent's ultimate Limit Break and must be obtained through a sidequest, it becomes this in *Dirge of Cerberus*.  (SPOILER)  After struggling with involuntary transformations into the being and realizing its true purpose, he manages to control it at the climax of the game and fights the final battle in his Chaos state. It boasts the highest possible attack damage and HP stats in the gameplay.

['90s Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NinetiesAntiHero): To an arguably bigger extent than Cloud. Vincent is clad in black leather; is brooding, angsty and mysterious; wields all sorts of cool and oversized guns; can turn into horror genre monsters- most notably a demon- and is even depicted in official artwork perched atop a rooftop at night like if he was [The Cowl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCowl). *Dirge of Cerberus* solidified these aspects already present in the original game.
['90s Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NinetiesHair): Back in his days as a Turk Vincent is sporting the side curtains.
[Alliterative Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlliterativeName): **V**incent **V**alentine.

[Aloof Ally](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AloofAlly): Though he canonically joined the heroes in the original game, Vincent started acting on his own by the time of *Advent Children* and tends to appear only in key moments to help his allies and then going back to working alone. It continues in *Dirge of Cerberus* as the other heroes work together off-screen as Vincent fights Deepground by himself.

[Anti Anti Christ](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiAntiChrist): Vincent's Chaos form exists for the specific purpose of killing all living beings to send all Livestream to Omega Weapon so that it heads off into space to find another planet to colonize. Instead it becomes one of mankind's greatest defenders thanks to Vincent, and, ultimately and ironically, the one who stops Omega Weapon from leaving the Planet, saving the world from being destroyed.
[Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero): He's shouldering a lot of guilt and is cold and stoic, but he's a good person beneath it and fights for what's right.
[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner): He fights to redeem himself for his failure to stop Hojo's experiments.
[Badass Cape](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCape): His iconic red mantle that he wears over his shoulders.
[Badass in a Nice Suit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassInANiceSuit): Back in his days as a Turk Vincent wore a snazzy professional suit and was already a proficient gunslinger.

[Bad Powers, Good People](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadPowersGoodPeople): Vincent's ability to transform into monstrous creatures isn't one usually associated with heroes. Even more so when he morphs into Chaos, who is supposed to be a harbinger of death to the planet. Still, Vincent is one of the heroes.

[The Berserker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBerserker): When he enters his transformations as his Limit Breaks, he becomes uncontrollable for the rest of the battle and attacks until all enemies are dead.
[BFG](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFG): His main weapon and most notably his "Cerberus", a massive Tri-barrelled revolver.

[Breakout Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakoutCharacter): Despite having some of the lowest stats in the game, he has become one of the most popular characters in the series. He was even popular enough to star in his own spinoff title.

[Byronic Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ByronicHero): Attractive? Check. Intelligent and passionate? Check. [Self-flagellating](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllMyFault) and self-absorbed over a tragic [Dark and Troubled Past](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkAndTroubledPast) in which he fell from grace and failed [the woman he loved from afar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLostLenore) whom he can never forget or move on from or forgive himself over, but which motivates him to an iconoclastic and sometimes self-destructive vendetta against the institutions that wronged him, regardless of the personal costs and risks it entails? Check, check, *check*.

[Commonality Connection](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CommonalityConnection): He becomes close with Red XIII in *On a Way to a Smile* because of their shared long lifespans and fear of outliving their loved ones. They even agree to meet annually in Midgar.

[Cross Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrossAttack): In *Dirge of Cerberus*, Vincent can adorn his handguns with cross-shaped pendants such as the Power Cross item.  (SPOILER)  When transforming into Chaos at the climax, Vincent wields two long revolvers with cross-shaped *barrels.*.

[Cutscene Power to the Max](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutscenePowerToTheMax): In *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*, Vincent pulls off amazing feats of [Gun Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunFu), [Supernatural Martial Arts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupernaturalMartialArts), and gravity-defying superhuman agility that would make [Dante](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DevilMayCry) jealous. But only in cutscenes; when you're controlling him, he can't do any of these things, and in fact, he can barely jump.

[Dark and Troubled Past](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkAndTroubledPast): To put it mildly. Vincent's past directly connects him to the creation of Sephiroth, something he blames himself for letting happen at Hojo's hands.

[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): He is dark-haired, clad in black leather, associated with the occult and the supernatural... but firmly well-meaning and righteous. This extends towards Chaos, his demonic and [Superpowered Evil Side](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperpoweredEvilSide) who is actually  (SPOILER)  a creation of the planet meant to be an accessory to the [Godzilla Threshold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodzillaThreshold) that is Omega .

[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding):  (SPOILER)  When he transforms into Chaos at the climax of *Dirge of Cerberus* he dual-wields a transformed version of the Death Penalty. It's only instance in the entire *Compilation* in which Vincent wields two guns.
[Eerie Pale-Skinned Brunette](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EeriePaleSkinnedBrunette): Vincent is very quiet and mysterious, and looks plain unsettling.
[Firing One-Handed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FiringOneHanded): All of his weapons work this way, even the rifles!
[Frankenstein's Monster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FrankensteinsMonster): His Death Gigas Limit Break, which attacks with [Livewire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe) and Gigadunk.
[Full-Name Basis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FullNameBasis): And odd recipient of the trope in *Dirge of Cerberus*. Even among his closest allies there are those who only refer to him by his full name.
[Glowing Eyes of Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlowingEyesOfDoom): *Dirge of Cerberus* shows that his natural crimson eyes glow bright red whenever he is about to transform into Chaos.
[Guest Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestFighter): Cameos as a fighter in *[Ehrgeiz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/Ehrgeiz)*.
[Gun Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunFu): The spin-offs have established him utilizing this with his handguns.

[Guns Are Worthless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunsAreWorthless): Subverted in the original game. His guns aren't very useful when he uses them to shoot enemies thanks to his low attack, but when he uses them to focus his magic they're very handy indeed, since his magic stat is much better.
[The Gunslinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGunslinger): In *Dirge Of Cerberus*, he fights with a variety of firearms and is a crack shot with all of them.

[Heroic RRoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicRROD): In *Dirge Of Cerberus*, Chaos is now not just one of Vincent's Limit Breaks but the most powerful of them, being a WEAPON in its own right. As such, while he can use the Galian Limit Break with no cost to the player he either collapses or is momentarily weakened after using Chaos during cutscenes, up until  (SPOILER)  the end of the game when he gains more control over Chaos and the player controls Vincent in Chaos form .

[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): Vincent is the main protagonist of the [Spin-Off](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpinOff) sequel *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*.

[Hockey Mask and Chainsaw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HockeyMaskAndChainsaw): His Limit Break Hellmasker, with the attacks [Splattercombo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainsawGood) and [Nightmare](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusInflictionAttack).
[Iconic Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicOutfit): His red cowl is easily recognizable among the fandom and he is never seen without it.
[Ineffectual Loner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IneffectualLoner): As cool as Vincent is, he keeps to himself thanks to his troubled past and naturally quiet nature.

[It's All My Fault](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllMyFault): He blames himself for Hojo's experiments with his and Lucrecia's own child. Vincent being shot and also submitted to the scientist's experiments is also something that he blames himself for.  (SPOILER)  He forgives himself at the end of *Dirge of Cerberus*.

[Legendary in the Sequel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LegendaryInTheSequel): In the original game, he was a [Secret Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretCharacter) largely unknown to the world, having spent decades sleeping in a coffin. By *Dirge of Cerberus*, however, he is recognized and spoken to in awe and respect by WRO soldiers.

[Limited Wardrobe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitedWardrobe): Outside of flashbacks during his Turks days, Vincent is always wearing his aforementioned [Iconic Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicOutfit). [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) confirmed they did this intentionally in *Advent Children*, as they felt that him changing outfits as the others had would conflict with his personality.
[Loners Are Freaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonersAreFreaks): He's naturally antisocial and keeps to himself.

[Long-Haired Pretty Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongHairedPrettyBoy): His hair reaches his back and is the resident [Tall, Dark, and Snarky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndSnarky). He's very popular with female fans, too.

[Love Hurts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveHurts): He fell in love with Lucrecia, who happened to be in a relationship with [Hojo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist). When Vincent protested Hojo using their child in his experiments, it got him a bullet in the gut for his trouble, and he became an experiment himself.

[Mage Marksman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MageMarksman): In *Dirge of Cerberus* he can fire magic bullets by equipping different materia to his gun. In the original game, Vincent displays good affinity with magic overall.
[Master of None](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterOfNone): He had fairly lackluster stats in the original game.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): His name hints to his tragic past and unrequited romance.

[My Greatest Failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGreatestFailure): He blames himself for all that happened to him and Lucrecia following her and Hojo's experiments with her child. Vincent regrets not doing more to convince Lucrecia of refusing to follow through with them.

[Ninja Pirate Zombie Robot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NinjaPirateZombieRobot): He looks and acts like a ninja vampire, and can shapeshift into [Captain Ersatz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CaptainErsatz) forms of famous movie monsters, namely Frankenstein's Monster, the Wolfman, and Jason Vorheez.
[Odd Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddFriendship): With Yuffie. Despite polar-opposite personalities, they get along well.
[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): Physically, he looks about 27, but he's chronologically in his early to mid 50s after sealing himself in a coffin.
[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel): In *Dirge of Cerberus*, he gains control over his transformations and becomes Chaos for the final battle.
[Optional Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalPartyMember): You can skip recruiting him in *VII*, but official canon establishes he did join the party.

[Our Demons Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurDemonsAreDifferent): His Chaos form is a giant black and red winged demon. In *VII* it's his ultimate Limit Break and attacks with [Chaos Saber](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RazorWings) and Satan Slam. *Dirge of Cerberus* expanded it into Vincent's [Superpowered Evil Side](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperpoweredEvilSide) that Lucrecia had forced upon him to save his life.

[Our Werewolves Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurWerewolvesAreDifferent): Invoked by his bestial Galian Beast form, which attacks with [Berserk Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapidfireFisticuffs) and [Beast Flare](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire).
[Power Floats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFloats): As Chaos, he never stands on the ground, preferring to hover above it. In *Dirge of Cerberus*, it can only fly and float above surfaces.

[Power Incontinence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerIncontinence):  (SPOILER)  When the Protomateria is removed from him in *Dirge of Cerberus*, he suffers from bouts of uncontrollable morphing into Chaos. Only at the climax Vincent manages to control his ultimate form.

[Power Limiter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerLimiter):  (SPOILER)  *Dirge of Cerberus* reveals he keeps his transformations under control due to the Protomateria inserted inside him by Lucrecia. When Rosso steals it from Vincent, he struggles with involuntary instances of morphing into Chaos.

tropeName: Red and Black and Evil All Over
tropeNotes: [Red and Black and Evil All Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedAndBlackAndEvilAllOver): [Played With](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedWith) in regards to Chaos, who is his [Superpowered Evil Side](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperpoweredEvilSide) and a dark demon with red in his wings to boot. However, Vincent uses his Chaos form to stand against the villains. [Averted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AvertedTrope) with his standard form, being a well-meaning anti-hero clad in black leather and wearing a red cape.
[Red Eyes, Take Warning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedEyesTakeWarning): Has crimson eyes. His human model for *Dirge of Cerberus* reveals it's their natural color.

[Red Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedIsHeroic): Wears a red [Badass Cape](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCape) and is one of the good guys, [despite his cold demeanor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero).
[Revolvers Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RevolversAreJustBetter): Some of his weapons, most notably the Peacemaker.
[Sawed-Off Shotgun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SawedOffShotgun): 1/3 of Vincent's weapons are shotguns, one even [being named "Shotgun"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlywhatItSaysOnTheTin).

[Sealed Good in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedGoodInACan): After Hojo was done experimenting on him, Vincent was horrified by what he had become and went to sleep in a coffin in Shinra Manor for years.
[Secret Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretCharacter): Finding him requires a short sidequest to reveal him.

[Shadow Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShadowArchetype): A heroic version but nonetheless he fits. A brooding loner haunted by the loss of a woman he loved at the hands of his arch-enemy? Vincent is what Cloud might become if he doesn't learn to cope with his issues. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) shares this viewpoint.

[Shapeshifter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShapeShifter): Can change into a wolf, a [Frankenstein's Monster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FrankensteinsMonster), a [Hockey Mask and Chainsaw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HockeyMaskAndChainsaw) style [slasher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlasherMovie), or the bat-winged and positively demonic [Chaos](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperpoweredEvilSide) during his [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).
[Sniper Rifle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SniperRifle): The aptly named Sniper CR, found in Mt. Nibel and could be bought in the Junon weapon shop.
[Squishy Wizard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SquishyWizard): He's the most magic-inclined character after Aerith, but his other stats are poor.
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): Very calm and not prone to a lot of emotion.

[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): He shares his long mane of jet-black hair and crimson eyes with his father, Grimoire Valentine. Even their outfits looks similar. Lucrecia mentions the resemblance in-universe.
[Super Mode](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperMode): How his Limit Breaks work. Everytime he morphs into a creature, he gains an increase in Max HP attack damage and resistance.
[Superpowered Evil Side](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperpoweredEvilSide): Chaos, a demonic entity sealed inside of him.

[Tall, Dark, and Handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome): Mostly back in his days as a Turk, where he was more conventionally attractive. However, Vincent still qualifies in the present, being a [Long-Haired Pretty Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongHairedPrettyBoy).
[Tall, Dark, and Snarky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndSnarky): Despite being cold and antisocial, Vincent has a wit about him.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass):
    - Vincent becomes a full-blown action hero in *Dirge of Cerberus*, displaying some degree of hand-to-hand combat skills along with a possible double jump skill and lots of [Gun Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunFu) and [Cutscene Power to the Max](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutscenePowerToTheMax). - (SPOILER) At the climax he takes another one when he finally gets his Chaos form under control. This time he gets equipped with a new version of his Death Penalty weapon: a pair of revolvers with cross-shaped barrels that fire beams of dark energy that deal some of the highest damage in the entire game.

[Tranquil Fury](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TranquilFury): Even when burning with hatred for Hojo for all that he's done, he never raises his voice beyond his usual stoic and understated tone. Though one can feel the rage in his dialogue, whether it's written or spoken. This seems to range to his expressions also - in *Dirge of Cerberus* he gives Hojo an icy [Death Glare](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathGlare) in the opening FMV and his anger towards him in the last game's boss fight is similarly restrained.

[The Undead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUndead): Vincent is, to all intents and purposes, a walking corpse animated only by Chaos. The resemblance to a vampire is purely intentional (although he's actually closer to a zombie when you get right down to it).
[Voluntary Shape Shifting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VoluntaryShapeShifting): Zigzagged. He changes form at will, but can't change back until battle ends.
[Ace Pilot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AcePilot): His backyard is fully of flying ships he's piloted, and he commands the party's airships.
[Artistic Age](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtisticAge): He is really 32 years old. You wouldn't think so considering his appearance in the game. In *Advent Children*, he looked more his age.

tropeName: Aw, Look! They Really Do Love Each Other
tropeNotes: [Aw, Look! They Really Do Love Each Other](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwLookTheyReallyDoLoveEachOther): Despite the fact that he verbally abuses his girlfriend, Shera, constantly throughout the game, he really does deeply care for her. He even names his new airship after her, and finally marries her some time between *Advent Children* and *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus).*

[Badass Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm): He doesn't show too much of it, but it requires a lot of patience, technical knowledge, and general intelligence to fly and maintain any aircraft. Cid's seen to be competent with light aircraft, a zeppelin-like airship, and a jet-type one, and was he hand picked to be the world's first astronaut and man in space.

[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): One of the most prominent examples. He doesn't have innate magical powers, an assault weapon for a hand, combat training, or genetic enhancements. He's got a homemade spear and dynamite.

[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): Cid's pretty protective of his toys, such as the Tiny Bronco and the Highwind. He's also extremely upset about Shinra's decision to cancel its space program.
[Bifurcated Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BifurcatedWeapon): Few of his weapons are halberds, axes attached on lances/spears that could function as both.

[Blue Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlueIsHeroic): Cid wears a blue jacket and is one of the good guys, [rough on the edges as he may be](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero). He's wearing a blue shirt in *Advent Children* and is notably much calmer.

[Boisterous Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoisterousBruiser): One of his reasons for joining the party is because he likes the idea of "numbskulls" fighting Shinra. Plus, he can back every word of his boasts up.
[Broomstick Quarterstaff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BroomstickQuarterstaff): Cid's joke weapon is a mop. It could be dug in Bone Village or bought in the Junon weapon shop.

[Cigar-Fuse Lighting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CigarFuseLighting): His Dynamite [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) has Cid lighting them with his cigarette before throwing it at enemies.
[Cluster F-Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClusterFBomb): He's much worse about this than Barret.

[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove) His Boost Jump, Hyper Jump and Dragon Dive Limit Breaks, where he leaps and descends to attack enemies. His final [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), "Highwind", combines this with [Macross Missile Massacre](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MacrossMissileMassacre).

tropeName: Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu?
tropeNotes: [Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustFlipOffCthulhu): Cusses out the Ultima Weapon when it appears at Mideel, tells it to [Bring It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BringIt) and demands it come back for more when it leaves the battle.

[Dragon Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonKnight): Cid is based of the Dragoon class, complete with the standard [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) (some of which even have "dragon" in its name) of the character class, even though he isn't one officially.

[Famous for Being First](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamousForBeingFirst): Cid was going to be the first man in space. Eventually he finally got into space, with a crew of other player characters (and Shera).
[Goggles Do Nothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GogglesDoNothing): Despite wearing a pair of goggles on his head, Cid never pulls them down. Likely they're there to tie into his pilot theme.
[Grumpy Old Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrumpyOldMan): Well, he's only 32, but that's old by Japanese anime/video game standards.
[Iconic Item](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicItem): Cid is never seen without his [goggles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GogglesDoNothing) in sequels, spin-offs, and every other crossover appearances.
[Improbable Piloting Skills](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobablePilotingSkills): He can pilot almost everything.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): He swears, smokes, is verbally abusive to pretty much everybody, but he gave up his dream to save Shera, genuinely tries to make amends with her, fights tooth and nail for the planet, joins the WRO, and gives a passionate speech about the need to protect the planet.

[Leeroy Jenkins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeeroyJenkins): He certainly has this attitude, even if he doesn't actually ruin any plans for the party, as shown by his gung-ho attitude about fighting Shinra.
[Life Drain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LifeDrain): Dragon drains HP from enemies to heal him.

[Macross Missile Massacre](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MacrossMissileMassacre): His ultimate [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) Highwind has him call in his airship of the same name to fire missiles at the enemy party.
[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): He is pretty much a meta-reference to *[Final Fantasy IV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyIV)*, from appearance to moves.
[Science Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScienceHero): Openly puts his faith in science, and his piloting skills are vital to the party.

[Senior Sleep-Cycle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeniorSleepCycle): Depicted as having one in-game, apparently as part of his grumpy old man portrayal. When the party is forced to stay at the Ghost Hotel in the Gold Saucer, Cloud's speech apparently puts him to sleep. Later, he is seen napping on the bridge of the Highwind just before Barret declares him to be the new leader. Finally, if the player chooses him to accompany Cloud on a gondola ride at Gold Saucer's Round Square, he will doze throughout the entire ride.
[Sir Swears-a-Lot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SirSwearsALot): Whatever cussing doesn't come from Barret likely comes from Cid.
[Smoking Is Cool](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmokingIsCool): Except when it's censored out... and yet still clearly visible.
[Spam Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpamAttack): Big Brawl is a series of rapid slash attacks.
[Team Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamDad): He's the third oldest of the party and is gruff and rude, but cares for them in his own way.
[Throw Down the Bomblet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowDownTheBomblet): Dynamite has him throw a stick of dynamite at enemies.
[You Are in Command Now](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreInCommandNow): His brief stint as team leader in Disc 2.
[Younger Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoungerThanTheyLook): Even though he's 32, he can be easily mistaken for a decade older. The years of chainsmoking help to justify this slightly.

[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): He's handsome, friendly, and a flirty ladies man, in addition to being a powerful and respected SOLDIER. [Justified](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope), in that this was intentional to have him contrast sharply with Cloud's [Classical Anti-Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClassicalAntiHero).

[All Your Powers Combined](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllYourPowersCombined): According to [the Ultimania guide](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual), this is how Zack learns his Limit Breaks — he meets someone, and upon doing so, learns how to copy their Limit Break and modify it to create his own, such as Meteorain->Meteor Shots and Healing Wind->Healing Wave.
[Anime Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimeHair): Zack has a lock of sharply spiked black hair. It changes styles during *Crisis Core* to show his growing maturity and aging, but it's still spiky.

[Been There, Shaped History](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeenThereShapedHistory): Besides his influence on Cloud's past, Zack was the guy who named the 7th Heaven bar, bought Aerith her iconic hair ribbon and suggested she sell flowers, and is partly responsible for sparking Yuffie's obsession with Materia.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): He fights using the Buster Sword. He wields a standard [Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword) before he inherits it.
[Blade Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeSpam): His Chain Slash and Octaslash DMW attacks are rapid slash combos.

[Breakout Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakoutCharacter): Arguably bigger than Vincent. Both got their own spinoff, but not only is Zack's better received, but Zack got the honor even though he only appeared in an optional flashback, as opposed to being a former playable character.

[Chekhov's Gunman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman): He is only mentioned off-handedly by Aerith, and an old couple who turn out to be his parents early in the game, but he holds the key to figuring out Cloud's past.
[Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet): Almost as much as Cloud. Case in point: Aerith *and* Cissnei in the same game. Way to go Zack.
[Colony Drop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColonyDrop): Meteor Shots fires meteors at enemies.

[Died in Your Arms Tonight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedInYourArmsTonight): Cloud is tending to him in his final moments. Once he dies, Cloud gives a haunting [Skyward Scream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SkywardScream).

[Doomed by Canon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedByCanon): *Final Fantasy VII* spoiled his eventual death long before *Crisis Core* came out. With Zack's death a pivotal piece of backstory, there was no way he could survive.

[Doomed Moral Victor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedMoralVictor): Though he defeats Genesis and keeps the pride and honor of SOLDIER alive, he dies defending Cloud from impossible numbers of Shinra forces.

[Dying Moment of Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingMomentOfAwesome): His [Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand) sees him taking on platoons of Shinra troops, only losing against the *last three* standing.

[Face Death with Dignity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceDeathWithDignity): Zack calmly utters his [Badass Creed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCreed) before taking on platoons of Shinra soldiers. While dying, he gives Cloud a motivational speech and [gives him the Buster Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeUpMySword) before succumbing to his wounds.

[Family-Unfriendly Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamilyUnfriendlyDeath): The flashback showing his death in the original game sees Zack getting repeatedly gunned down, though it was a [Bloodless Carnage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodlessCarnage) due to the limited technology at the time. Tellingly, the more rendered *Crisis Core* gives it a [Gory Discretion Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoryDiscretionShot) by showing it through Zack's point of view (though he is seen bleeding to death afterwards).

[Foregone Conclusion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForegoneConclusion): Since *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)* is a prequel to *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*, and Zack's the hero in the game, it's fairly expected when he dies at the end.

[Forgotten Fallen Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForgottenFallenFriend): Of Cloud. He remembers him again later in the story, causing him to have a [Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD), but he gets better.
[Guest Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestFighter): In *[Ehrgeiz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/Ehrgeiz)*, he makes a cameo.
[Gunship Rescue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunshipRescue): His Air Strike DMW attack has Zack call Tseng to bring in a Turk helicopter to unleash machine gun and missiles on enemies.
[Healing Hands](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingHands): Healing Wave fully restores his stats.

[The Hero Dies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeroDies): Zack is the [Doomed by Canon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedByCanon) protagonist of *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)*, a [Prequel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Prequel) game set before *FFVII*.
[Heroes Prefer Swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesPreferSwords): He fights exclusively with swords, as with all SOLDIER members.
[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): Zack is the main protagonist of the prequel game *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)*.
[Instant Runes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstantRunes): Apocalypse creates a red rune of energy below enemies that shocks them.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): Implied in the original game and then retconned with *[Crisis Core](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/CrisisCore)*. Cloud in the original game could give some pretty dickish responses in the dialogue trees. The game's [Reveal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReveal), where it's learned that he based his badass persona on Zack's, seems to indicate that he picked this up from Mr. Fair. *Crisis Core*, however does away with all of this and writes Zack as a heroic and energetic [Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy). [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) and creation materials have given a [Hand Wave](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandWave) that Cloud's fake persona was based on *his* image of a SOLDIER rather than specifically Zack, thus he'd also take some traits from [Sephiroth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SugarAndIcePersonality), [The Hero's Idol](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHerosIdol).
[Jumped at the Call](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JumpedAtTheCall): Zack is always eager to prove himself and fight to do the right thing.

[Keet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Keet): He's very energetic and excitable; Angeal has nicknamed him "the puppy" for it. His [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) has him temper it into a more mature and focused type of character without losing his lightheartedness.

[Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand): At the end of *Crisis Core* he finds himself standing alone against dozens, perhaps hundreds, of Shinra infantry. He recites Angeal's [Arc Words](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArcWords) and charges in swinging, bringing down all but three before he's too weak to keep standing. (Canonically, Shinra sent a full battalion of men which means anywhere from 300-1000 Shinra troopers were deployed to take down this one SOLDIER...and only 3 survived.)
[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak): His DMW attacks.

[Love Makes You Dumb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveMakesYouDumb): Despite knowing that Shinra is hunting him with orders to kill, he still attempts to return to Midgar, Shinra's headquarters, to see Aerith again.
[Manly Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyTears): After  (SPOILER) Angeal's  death, he breaks down in the church and sobs while Aerith holds him.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): He didn't have a last name until *Crisis Core*, when he was given the last name "Fair" to invoke the imagery of "fair weather", contrasting Cloud's name.
[Mr. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFanservice): He's handsome and well-built, and has a scene where he walks around on the beach in swim trunks.
[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): Zack is everyone's friend and this trope is the reason why, he's just very pleasant and friendly.

[Obliviously Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviouslyEvil): Throughout most of *Crisis Core*, Zack is working for Shinra, and opens the game with helping them subjugate Wutai, but is presented as fully believing in Shinra's propaganda and not understanding why the Wutaians would oppose the use of mako energy to improve the lives of their citizens. The majority of the game dials the resulting moral dissonance back by focusing on a civil war where Shinra is the lesser evil compared to Hollander and Genesis.

[One-Man Army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneManArmy): Being the sole playable character in an Action RPG, Zack racks up a body count in the multiple thousands. Highlighted at the very first mission of the game, where Zack's objective is to storm and capture a Wutai fort by himself. He does it with ease; keep in mind he's still "just" Second Class at this time. A series of missions pits Zack against swarms of Shinra infantryman, culminating in a battle with *1000* soldiers.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): In *VII* and beyond, he's long dead.

[Power Copying](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerCopying): In *Crisis Core*, Zack's Digital Mind Wave ability allows him to copy and adapt others characters' [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).

[Present Absence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PresentAbsence): Zack's death is the reason Cloud still lives in the first place. Cloud even modeled himself after Zack, which is also an integral part of his character. In *Advent Children*, Cloud is seen mourning his death along with Aerith's.

[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): Zack merely appears in Cloud's flashbacks in the original game. In many spin-offs, notably *Crisis Core*, he's a playable character.
[Purple Is Powerful](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PurpleIsPowerful): Zack wears the purple SOLDIER 1st class uniform is certainly a formidable fighter.
[Rapid-Fire Fisticuffs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapidFireFisticuffs): Rush Assault is a barrage of lightning-fast punches ending with an explosive diving tackle.

[Right Handed Mirror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RightHandedMirror): As Cloud is, he is this to Sephiroth. Their backstories and origins are even more similar, but Zack becomes a hero while Sephiroth descends further and further into madness and villainy.

[Scars are Forever](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScarsAreForever): The [X-shaped scar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/XMarksTheHero) on the lower part of his cheek.  (SPOILER) Angeal gave it to him in pushing Zack to kill him.
[Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShirtlessScene): The Costa del Sol scene in *Crisis Core* features Zack in his swim trunks hanging out at the beach.
[Sleeves Are for Wimps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleevesAreForWimps): Wears a sleeveless outfit (except maybe for shoulder guards) and he fights using [very large swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS).
[Spirit Advisor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpiritAdvisor): Gives Cloud some advice throughout *Advent Children* despite being long dead.
[Status Buff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusBuff): Lucky Stars makes all his attacks Critical Hits for a time.
[Super-Soldier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSoldier): As a SOLDIER, he has superior strength, reflexes, healing, stamina, and magic proficiency.
[Take Up My Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeUpMySword): The [Retconned](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Retcon) ending to *Crisis Core*, and his inheritance of said sword from his mentor.
[Tall, Dark, and Handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome): He's six-feet tall, dark-haired and wears dark outfits, and is very good-looking.

[Together in Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TogetherInDeath): Him and Aerith, but it's more like Together In The Lifestream. Interesting because most people's consciousness will dissolve into the Lifestream after death.

[Token Good Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate): He works for Shinra, and helped to end the Wutai War leaving the place in the condition it's seen in *Final Fantasy VII*, but his interests were starting a new life, becoming a true hero, and protecting Cloud. It wasn't until after it became clear that Shinra wasn't going to stop hunting them down that Zack opposed them.

[Walking Spoiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingSpoiler): In the original *Final Fantasy VII*, his entire existence is a major plot twist that goes hand-in-hand with major revelations about Cloud's backstory.

[Wouldn't Hurt a Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldntHurtAChild): While mowing his way through a Wutai stronghold on Shinra's behalf, Zack gets blindsided by Yuffie's sudden appearance, as she vows to defend her homeland to the death and stop Zack at any cost. Zack simply feigns losing to her bravado in the hopes that she'll go away (she does), establishing that as deadly and efficient he is against enemy combatants, he wouldn't turn his blade on innocents or children who can't fight back.
["X" Marks the Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/XMarksTheHero): The main protagonist of *Crisis Core* and has an x-shaped scar on the left side of his cheek.

[All for Nothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllForNothing): Once the company realizes that the Promised Land that they’ve been looking for doesn’t exist they immediately loose their cool as they were planning to build Neo Midgar in that place.

[Arc Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArcVillain): They act as the initial antagonists of *Final Fantasy VII* within Midgar, until Sephiroth puts a sword through President Shinra's gut and the narrative turns attention to his schemes and the party leaves Midgar to pursue him.
