[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): "Shelke" is urdu for "orange", while her title refers to her power to turn invisible. Her title in Japanese in a pun; it can be read as both "Expressionless", referring to her stoic nature, or "Colorless", foreshadowing her leaving the Tsviets.
[Medium Awareness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MediumAwareness): In the game's online mode, she tells the player character that her special attack uses "a lot of MP".

[Morality Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityPet): To Vincent. Vincent himself could be her morality pet as well, as being around him sparks her [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment).
[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): She's 19 but looks half that thanks to her aging being halted.
[Power Degeneration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerDegeneration): The experiments performed on her force her to have daily baths in Mako to sustain her life.
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): For the most of the time. Only at the near ending does she begin to show off her more emotional sides.

tropeName: What Is This Thing You Call "Love"?
tropeNotes: [What Is This Thing You Call "Love"?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatIsThisThingYouCallLove): After she had spent ten years with Deepground, it ain't no wonder that she hasn't learnt what love is. When  (SPOILER) Shalua sacrifices herself for her  and Vincent tries to be her friend, she first reacts with coldness and surprise, and then with curiosity. She eventually learns what love is by the end.
[The Blacksmith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBlacksmith): Argent made all of the Tsviets' [Named Weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedWeapons).
[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): She wields an ornate sword, seemingly a reinforced version of the standard-issue SOLDIER blade.
[Eyepatch of Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyepatchOfPower): She wears an eyepatch and part of her dialogue indicates that she is exceedingly strong.
[Inconsistent Spelling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InconsistentSpelling): Argent or Argento? It's pronounced the same either way.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Her name means "Silver" in Italian, for her outfit. However, she's not given a matching colored title like the other Tsviets.
[The Philosopher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePhilosopher): Her speech, full of idioms, indicates this.

[Sequel Non-Entity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SequelNonEntity): She shows up in the online Mode for all of five minutes, then we never see her again. Presumably she was killed in the fight with the Restrictors.
[Zen Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZenSurvivor): Easily the most chill of all the Tsviets.
[Asshole Victim](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AssholeVictim): His death was well-deserved.

[Bad Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadBoss): Even worse than Weiss. Restrictor often belittles and abuses recruits just because it is fun, while using the chips preventing them from biting back. No one cares much when he dies.

tropeName: But for Me, It Was Tuesday
tropeNotes: [But for Me, It Was Tuesday](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButForMeItWasTuesday): He does not remember much about victims he'd caused, less so the Player's younger sister he'd (supposedly) killed.  (SPOILER) The fact he does not remember is a first sign that the Player's memories are false.
[Dirty Coward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DirtyCoward): Restrictor is skilled in fighting, but most of time, he uses restraining chips to make others obey. When Weiss kills him, he begs for his life.
[Evil Versus Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilVersusEvil): His conflict against Weiss and their rivalry for being the strongest ruler in Deepground. Both are violent and atrocious people.
[Actually a Doombot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActuallyADoombot): The "Sephiroth" hunted throughout Discs I and II is really a Jenova mass in his form and directed by his will.

[Aliens Are Bastards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AliensAreBastards): Jenova is a genocidal monster from space that is completely impossible to reason with, and even the lifeforms she doesn't personally kill can be corrupted or destroyed by proximity to her.

[Ambiguous Gender](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousGender): Zig-zagged. Nearly everyone refers to Jenova as “she”, and she has a female body, but Ifalna calls Jenova a “he” or “it” depending on what version of the game you’re playing. As she can alter her form at will, it’s not even confirmed if the body we see in Nibelheim is actually her true form.

[Ancient Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AncientEvil): She is an ancient being who came to Gaia two thousand years ago, and who almost caused [The End of the World as We Know It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEndOfTheWorldAsWeKnowIt), consumed almost all of the [Ancient Cetra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Precursors), and plans to consume all the energy in the planet and then depart to another planet to do it again.

[Angelic Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngelicAbomination): At the Nibel Reactor, Jenova's container is covered by a metal effigy which resembles the torso of an angel, with "wings" (industrial tubing) obscuring the rest of the container. Connected to the ceiling are cables bearing the appearance of golden hair. When Sephiroth arrives to free her, he poses like Christ and says he's taking her to the Promised Land.

[Applied Phlebotinum](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AppliedPhlebotinum): SOLDIER was a spin-off of Project Jenova, an attempt to produce a human-Cetra hybrid using her cells. Since only the heartiest can withstand Jenova's influence (and not go insane), SOLDIER has a reputation for producing the best of the best.
[Arch-Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArchEnemy): The Cetra and, by proxy, Aerith.

[The Assimilator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAssimilator): Jenova released a virus upon the Cetra (in actuality, its own cellular material), which drove the Cetra mad and transformed them into monsters. By the time of *Final Fantasy VII*, this starts happening to members of SOLDIER as well.

[Beam Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeamSpam): The first form of Jenova fought in the game, Jenova-BIRTH, uses a multitude of beam attacks including its own version of the Guard Scorpion's infamous Tail Laser, which it can actually use twice in a row and at any time (the Guard Scorpion only uses the laser when attacked while its tail was up).
[Bishōnen Line](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BishonenLine): Jenova's body looks incomplete in her early boss battles. Much like Hojo, she gains flight ability and a more streamlined appearance in Disc 3.
[Body Horror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror): Among other things. She has an eyeball on her breast, and her innards float in the tank outside her body.
[Brain in a Jar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrainInAJar): The top of Jenova's cranium is missing, leaving her brain exposed.

[Bright Is Not Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrightIsNotGood): All of Jenova’s forms are brightly colored, but [the exact shades evoke corpses and mutilation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilIsVisceral): bloody browns and reds, bruised blues and purples, pinkish whites and rotten greens. This stands in contrast to both [Sephiroth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrayscaleOfEvil) and the [warmer-colored AVALANCHE](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodColorsEvilColors).

[Combat Tentacles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatTentacles): Jenova-SYNTHESIS. She has twin tentacles that self-regenerate and "slap" the party for around 1,500 HP each, along with inflicting Silence and Fury with repeated whacks. These tentacles can be killed temporarily, but they do count towards Jenova's overall health.

[Crater Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CraterPower): The Northern Cave formed from the impact of her arrival. The lifestream burst forth to heal the 'wound' caused by Jenova, but was unsuccessful in fixing it (thanks to the deaths of the Cetra). This gives the appearance of a crater *within* a crater.

[Dead Person Impersonation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadPersonImpersonation):
    - Once the creature emerged from the impact site and approached the Cetra settlement, it read their minds and adopted the forms of dead relatives to get close to them. - Hojo duped Sephiroth into believing this thing is his real mother. Thanks to the Jenova cells in her body, Lucrecia was unable to die, though; instead she fled, eventually winding up in the Crystal Cave where she turned herself to crystal (as a penance and, perhaps, to stop herself from mutating).

[Death from Above](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathFromAbove): Personified; she struck the planet in a meteor and caused massive death. In the Cetra language, her name translates as "Calamity From The Sky".

[Diabolus ex Nihilo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiabolusExNihilo): [Fell from the sky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CameFromTheSky) two thousand years before the game began. No one knows where it came from, but it's speculated that it may have landed on & devastated other worlds in the past.

[Disc-One Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneFinalBoss): Literally; her second incarnation of Jenova-LIFE, which attacks you after she/Sephiroth attacks and kills Aerith, is the very last fight on the first disc of gameplay.

[The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon): She is this to Sephiroth. During the story he used Jenova as a puppet while fighting Avalanche, and Sephiroth also used Jenova to disguise as himself and serve as the second to last boss before the heroes fight Sephiroth himself.

[Dug Too Deep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DugTooDeep): A small band of un-mutated Cetra mounted a final assault on the alien, [sealing her body](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedEvilInACan) at the point of arrival: the North Crater. Two thousand years later the alien would be excavated by Shinra Electric Power Company.

[Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination): She came from the heavens in a meteor to destroy humanity, can shapeshift, bestows a variety of incredible powers on those exposed to her cells, and is stated to have no gender.

[Evil Is Visceral](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilIsVisceral): In her original and final forms, Jenova's body is sprouting from a giant heart. Her "body" is haphazardly put together, as though by an alien which doesn't understand human anatomy.

[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Jenova and some of her offspring (Helletic Hojo, especially) were based on the titular alien in John Carpenter's *[The Thing (1982)](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheThing1982)*.
[Eyes Do Not Belong There](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyesDoNotBelongThere): The original specimen has an eye where her right nipple should be. Along with a second eyeball coming out of her abdomen.
[Four Is Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourIsDeath): The player has to face Jenova 4 times in *Final Fantasy VII*, including one last time before facing Sephiroth at the end of the game.
[From a Single Cell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FromASingleCell): Jenova has powerful regenerative and shapeshifting abilities, making it difficult to permanently destroy her.
[Fusion Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FusionDance): With Sephiroth, to the point that he's taken her originally instinctive destructive goals and infused them with his own conscious intelligence.

[Greater-Scope Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreaterScopeVillain): Jenova's not completely in charge of Sephiroth or his actions, and due to the nature of her being cannot be directly confronted. In fact, whether she's even *alive* is up for debate. But the facts remain that if she hadn't come down to earth two thousand years ago, most of the events of the game wouldn't have happened.

[Humanoid Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAbomination): Resembles a deathly pale woman with eyes and veins in places where they should not be, but is an ancient, shapeshifting, planet eating entity from the depths of space.

[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): "Heaven's Dark Harbinger" and "The Calamity from the Sky" to the Cetra, "Mother" to Sephiroth, "Jenova" to Gast, which several other characters use. The entity is [never referred to by its true name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoNameGiven), assuming it has one.

[Leitmotif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Leitmotif): Jenova's main theme is a creepy, fast-paced alien theme with violins called "J-E-N-O-V-A". This theme plays over two of the boss fights with her (Jenova-BIRTH and Jenova-DEATH) plus the fight with Hojo and the two screens inbetween passing *FFVII's* [Point of No Return](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PointOfNoReturn) and the Jenova-SYNTHESIS boss fight (the Jenova-LIFE boss fight has Aerith's Theme over it and the fight with Jenova-SYNTHESIS uses a different theme called "Jenova Complete/Jenova Absolute"). A rendition of "J-E-N-O-V-A" plays over Cloud's fight with Kadaj over Jenova's head in ''Advent Children".

[Living MacGuffin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingMacGuffin): When Dr. Gast found the remains of Jenova, he mistook it for a Cetra—naturally, since Jenova took the form of a Cetra to infiltrate and destroy them. The Jenova Project was an effort by a number of Shinra scientists to use Jenova's cells to create a human-Cetra hybrid who could lead them to the "Promised Land." Shinra was unsuccessful at cloning a Cetra, but those treated with the cells proved to be super-soldiers, which led to Sephiroth going mad and Cloud losing his memory.

[Losing Your Head](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LosingYourHead): Knowing Jenova can repair herself (and even recover her lost body parts), Sephiroth hacked off her head with the Masamune. When Sephiroth took a tumble into the Mako pool, he took his mother's scalp with him. She rears her ugly head again, pun intended, in the Northern Cave. This is presumably the last of the Jenova segments.

[Lovecraftian Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LovecraftianSuperpower): For some reason, organisms that are exposed to the Jenova cells mutate into grotesque abominations and often grow a wing-like appendage from their backs. When Hojo shoots himself up with her DNA, he turns into a writhing mass of flesh, with a tattered labcoat and glasses.

[Making a Splash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash): The second form of Jenova, which AVALANCHE fights immediately after the famous scene of Sephiroth killing Aerith, attacks with only water. A Water Ring can be picked up and equipped not too long before this fight, which will absorb the attacks and make it impossible for Jenova to kill you.

[Metaphorically True](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MetaphoricallyTrue): As Vincent says to the rest of the party when they meet, the claim that Jenova is Sephiroth's mother is true in a sense, since her cells made him what he is, although it was actually Dr Lucrecia Crescent who gave birth to him.
[Monster Progenitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MonsterProgenitor): Experiments with her cells have produced most of the major antagonists of the FFVII Compilation.
[Mysterious Past](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysteriousPast): What Jenova did before landing on Gaia remains a mystery.
[No Name Given](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoNameGiven): "Jenova" is a name the character received from Gast Faremis, the character's real name if one exists is unknown.
[One Bad Mother](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneBadMother): In a way. Kadaj, Yazoo, Loz, and Sephiroth all address her as "Mother" anyway.

[Outside-Context Problem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutsideContextProblem): Compared to Shinra, who are sucking the planet dry for money, and Sephiroth, who wishes to destroy the world and remake it [In Their Own Image](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InTheirOwnImage). Jenova is an eons-old, planet-eating [Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination) of questionable sapience.
[Parts Unknown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PartsUnknown): It is never specified where the mysterious entity originated from beyond being from space.
[People Jars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PeopleJars): Jenova's remains are kept in cold storage in Hojo's lab.

[The Plague](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePlague): The Geostigma of *Advent's Children* is the result of the human body's immune system trying to cure itself of her cells and overcompensating, causing pain, weakness, lesions, and ultimately death.

[Planet Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlanetEater): The only antagonist whose motives are completely unknown and unknowable, mostly due to being a cosmic horror. According to the Cetra, Jenova feeds on entire planets and then converts them into a vehicle to invade new ones.
[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): The third form of Jenova the team has to kill uses only fire attacks; having a Fire Ring equipped will make this battle a cinch.
[Power Floats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFloats): Jenova-SYNTHESIS is the first and last incarnation to float.
[Pre-Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PreFinalBoss): Before the party can face off against Sephiroth, they have to fight Jenova one last time in the form of Jenova SYNTHESIS.
[Pulling Themselves Together](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PullingThemselvesTogether): Jenova is hacked to pieces before the game starts.

[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss): AVALANCHE has to fight Jenova 4 times as the game progresses (3 of which are [palette swaps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PaletteSwap)); with the right equipment, only the first and the last battles will require some effort.
[Rule of Symbolism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleOfSymbolism): Her name is a combination of "nova" and "Jehovah", and thus approximately means "New God".

[Shapeshifting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShapeShifting): Jenova would shapeshift into the loved ones of her victims to get close to them. In the modern day Sephiroth uses this power of hers to form new bodies in his own image to act through.

[Silent Antagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilentAntagonist): She has exactly *one* line of dialogue attributed to her, providing her quote above. All other times it's Sephiroth speaking through her.
[Tainted Veins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TaintedVeins): Her veins pulse blue.

[Taking You with Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingYouWithMe): After Jenova-SYNTHESIS loses enough health, she begins charging up an Ultima attack to try to wipe out the party; if the team is unable to kill it before it fires but survives the attack, Jenova self-destructs.

[The Virus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheVirus): People and animals who are injected with Jenova's cells become victims of numerous side effects, including [mutation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror) and susceptibility to [Mind Control](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MindControl). She's [The Virus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheVirus) incarnate.

[White Hair, Black Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteHairBlackHeart): While her hair looks blue due to the color of the fluid she's in, it's actually white. As for the black heart, she's a planet-eating [Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination) that mutates people into monsters.

[Xenomorph Xerox](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/XenomorphXerox): *Final Fantasy: Mobius* game gives Jenova∙LIFE a Gigeresque makeover with segmented tentacles, an elongated eyeless head, and a ridged black-and-red exoskeleton.

[Zero-Effort Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZeroEffortBoss): The second and third encounters with Jenova can become completely trivial if the player equips a specific accessory prior to these boss fights due to these two forms using only elemental attacks (water for the second form, and fire for the third; equip a Water Ring that you can find just prior and a Fire Ring respectively and it becomes impossible to lose these fights.)
[All Men Are Perverts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllMenArePerverts): The Don and his cronies are all lustful for Cloud and his companions.

[Asshole Victim](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AssholeVictim): The novella "*Lateral Biography Turks -The Kids Are Alright-*" reveals he survived his fall in Wutai, but is now confined to a wheelchair due to the injuries he sustained. Couldn't have happened to a nicer guy.
[Bald of Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BaldOfEvil): He's bald aside from a wisp of blond hair.
[Chekhov's Gunman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman): He returns during the Wutai subquest.

[Dirty Old Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DirtyOldMan): He's an aging crime boss who kidnaps women looking for someone to spend the night with. When presented with Aerith, Tifa, and the crossdressed Cloud, he's ecstatic at the idea of having a choice, and gives the two he doesn't choose to his men to enjoy. Even when on the run from the Turks in Wutai, he can't help but kidnap Elena and Yuffie (the latter of whom is *sixteen*) the second he spots them, which bites him in the ass when Cloud and the Turks come gunning for him.

[Disney Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyDeath): Though Reno drops him off a mountain in Wutai, "*Lateral Biography Turks -The Kids Are Alright-*" reveal he's still alive by the time of *Advent Children*.
[Disney Villain Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyVillainDeath): He meets his apparent end falling off Wutai's mountain.
[The Don](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDon): His title and position.
[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Of Jabba the Hutt. He's a gluttonous, lecherous crime boss who feeds his harem and people who cross him to a giant beast he keeps at the bottom of a trapdoor.
[Fat Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FatBastard): He's overweight and a perverted crime boss.

[Fate Worse than Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FateWorseThanDeath): He survives his apparently deadly fall in Wutai, but ends up crippled and living in a wheelchair. The reason this is a fate worse than death for him is that it means he can no longer have sex, rendering his whole existence empty.
[Groin Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GroinAttack): Cloud, Aerith and Tifa get him to spill the beans about Shinra's plans by threatening him with this.
[Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn): In supplemental materials after his defeats to AVALANCHE and the Turks, he ends up helping the WRO supply fuel and restore the world.
[He Knows Too Much](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeKnowsTooMuch): After spilling the beans to the party about Shinra's plans, he flees the city pursued by the Turks who plan to silence him.

[Hoist by His Own Petard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HoistByHisOwnPetard): He made a decent attempt to escape from the Turks in Wutai, but he couldn't help himself and kidnapped Elena and Yuffie out of lust. This led to an [Enemy Mine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnemyMine) situation between Cloud and the Turks that led to his [Disney Villain Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyVillainDeath).

[Ineffectual Sympathetic Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IneffectualSympatheticVillain): He's just this side of Palmer as the most pathetic villain in the series. He's cowed into submission by one ex-SOLDIER and two civilian women (albeit, both of whom are capable fighters). He does have "pets" which he siccs on the party in Midgar and Wutai, but even those don't help increase his threat level.
[Leitmotif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Leitmotif): "Don of the Slums", which plays in his mansion and when he reappears in Wutai.

[Punny Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunnyName): In Italian, *corneo* means horny, as in "made of, or resembling horn." In English, horny can mean "made of, or resembling horn" but is also very common slang for sexual arousal.

tropeName: Rape Is a Special Kind of Evil
tropeNotes: [Rape Is a Special Kind of Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapeIsASpecialKindOfEvil): He sexually assaults countless women up until he runs into Cloud and his crew, including Leslie's wife Merle. In *A Turks Side Story*, Evan Townshend is revolted by his actions and informs Leslie that Corneo is using the pictures as blackmail material. [Leslie promptly worms his way back into the Don's good graces](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuileHero) simply so he can burn his mansion and the evidence to the ground.
[Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut): His name is obviously inspired by [Don Corleone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheGodfather).

[Too Dumb to Live](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooDumbToLive): When you're the run from the Turks, kidnapping one of their members isn't a good idea, to say the least. He also ran off with the friend of the guy who caused him to be on the run in the first place, so things could only end badly for him.

[Took a Level in Kindness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInKindness): The novella "*Lateral Biography Turks -The Kids Are Alright-*" portrays him as a fuel supplier managing things between Shinra and the WRO and helping them restore the planet. Granted, this is only because there's little else he can do anymore.
[Arm Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArmCannon): Had a gun grafted onto his arm, just like Barret.

[Asshole Victim](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AssholeVictim): Averted in Barret's case, but after realizing that Dyne was killed, at least one of the Corel Prison employees, Mr. Coates, only feels relieved that the place can be calmer and better without Dyne around.

[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy): By the time you find him, his sanity is just about gone. He regularly goes on murderous rampages, claims he can hear voices in his head, and even expresses a desire to murder his own child.

[Disney Villain Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyVillainDeath): Suffers this twice. The first time, he and Barret were shot by Shinra/Scarlet, but he survived minus his left arm, which became a gun. The second time, he jumps in himself, and this time, he dies for real.

[Driven to Madness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenToMadness): After the destruction of Corel, Dyne goes insane. He has his arm replaced with a machine gun and he regularly goes on murderous rampages in the hope of one day killing everyone.

[Driven to Suicide](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenToSuicide): He jumps off a cliff after being defeated by Barret, believing he had too much blood on his hands to ever have the right to hold his daughter again.
[Duel Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DuelBoss): The reunion between Dyne and Barret in the Corel Prison leads to him forcing Barret to fight him alone.

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart): To Barret. Both of them lost everything to Shinra, both lost a hand, both replaced it with a gun, and both are filled with a lot of murderous rages. However, while Barret was able to maintain some decency within himself, in large part thanks to [Marlene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityPet), Dyne was completely consumed by his anger.
[Evil Former Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilFormerFriend): Was Barret's close friend before he went off the deep end. Much more one-sided on Dyne's part though.
[Offing the Offspring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffingTheOffspring): Upon hearing that Marlene survived the destruction of Corel he wanted to kill her to reunite her with her mother.

[Properly Paranoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProperlyParanoid): He was the only person in Corel to protest Shinra constructing a Mako Reactor. When the first incarnation of AVALANCHE blew the reactor up, Shinra blamed Corel for it, burning the town down and killing almost everyone; the few survivors left outside of Barret, Dyne and Marlene settled in North Corel.

[Taking You with Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingYouWithMe): Possibly. Once his HP hits zero, he has a 50/50 chance to use Molotov Cocktail before keeling over. That means if you could get wiped out by it, you have to hope luck is on your side.

[These Hands Have Killed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheseHandsHaveKilled): He turns down Barret's offer to unite him with his daughter, citing that a man with hands as blood-stained as his shouldn't ever hold a child. However, Barret gives him a ["Not So Different" Remark](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoDifferentRemark) in anguish that his hands aren't clean either, as he was too late to prevent Dyne jumping off a cliff.

[Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WoobieDestroyerOfWorlds): Losing his home, friends and family turned him into a bitter shell of a man who wants only to wipe everything from the face of the earth.
[Artifact of Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtifactOfDoom): The Materia to summon it can end the world in the wrong hands.
[Dismantled MacGuffin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DismantledMacGuffin): A variant; the Zirconiade Materia itself is intact, but its support Materia are scattered around the planet.
[Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination): Its a giant mass of spikes, blades, and wings.

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart): To the Weapons. While Zirconiade is a Summon Materia that will destroy the planet, the Weapons exist to protect it. Zirconiade's name parallels the Weapons; while they're named after precious stones, Zirconiade takes its name from Zirconia, as in "cubic zirconia", fake diamonds.
[Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss): Of *Before Crisis*.
[Sealed Evil in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedEvilInACan): It'll destroy the world if unleashed.
[Spikes of Villainy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpikesOfVillainy): It's very, shall we say, "pointy".
[Artificial Human](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialHuman): They're formed out of pure tainted Lifestream energy by Sephiroth's will.
[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): Some handle it better than others, but they all get annoyed whenever someone brings up Jenova in a flippant manner.

[Beta Test Baddie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BetaTestBaddie): They're each incomplete copies of Sephiroth, and their drive to find Jenova is out of a need to reunite with her so Sephiroth can be reborn properly.
[Cain and Abel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CainAndAbel): They consider Cloud their "brother" through Jenova, and fight and try to kill him several times since they view him as a traitor to her.

[Even Evil Has Loved Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasLovedOnes): In a very twisted way. They actually think Jenova is their mother and want to find her and be with her again. Kadaj goes so far as to consider children infected with Geostigma, which is a result of them being infected with Jenova cells, as his "brothers", which makes them all a family.

[Flanderization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Flanderization): They're the result of Sephiroth undergoing in-universe Flanderization. Allowing his own memories to fragment and be stripped away, Sephiroth had to rely on memories of how other people saw him to create the remnants, resulting in each of them being an exaggerated depiction of a different aspect of his true character.

[Freudian Trio](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianTrio): Loz is the Id, being a [Manchild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManChild) with simplistic emotions, Kadaj is the Ego, being the comparatively level-headed leader but prone to fits of rage and anger, and Yazoo is the Superego, being always calm and collected.
[Hell-Bent for Leather](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellBentForLeather): Each wears a black leather outfit that, in different ways, mimic Sephiroth's iconic attire.
[Hellish Pupils](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellishPupils): All three have slitted, catlike pupils, emphasizing their nature as Sephiroth's incarnations.

[Literal Split Personality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LiteralSplitPersonality): They each embody a different aspect of Sephiroth. Kadaj has his cruelty and insanity, as well as his preference for katanas, Loz has his speed, physical strength and obsession with Jenova, and Yazoo has his charisma, aloofness, and with his longer hair bears the closest physical resemblance to him.

[Psychopathic Manchild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychopathicManchild): While Kadaj is the most blatant example, all three are fiercely devoted to their "mother" and are more than a bit unstable and destructive in their search to find her.
[Siblings in Crime](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SiblingsInCrime): They're all brothers, and occasionally bicker or banter with each other during the film.
[A Sinister Clue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ASinisterClue): All of them, much like their "progenitor", wield their weapons in their left hands and share his contempt for the world.
[Summon Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonMagic): They can summon monsters from tainted Lifestream called "Shadow Creepers".

[Terrible Trio](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerribleTrio): Kadaj is the leader and the one with the most knowledge of Sephiroth's plans, while Loz and Yazoo carry out efforts to find Jenova and do most of the fighting as Kadaj watches.

[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn): They're just incarnations of Sephiroth's will meant to find Jenova so he can be reborn. Loz and Yazoo have no idea of this, while Kadaj has some measure of understanding, but is still unaware of his true purpose.
[White Hair, Black Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteHairBlackHeart): Being they're each embodiments of Sephiroth, they share this key design trait.

[And Then What?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AndThenWhat): Kadaj isn't sure what to do once he  (SPOILER) has his hands on Jenova's head.  Cloud lampshades this is because he's just a remnant, he's driven by instinct with no understanding of what he's doing.

[Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad): Of *Advent Children*, where he's after Jenova's cells to try and bring Sephiroth [Back from the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackFromTheDead). He may be a pawn, but he's nonetheless [The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy).

[Contrasting Sequel Antagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContrastingSequelAntagonist): Sephiroth was a world-famous [Fallen Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FallenHero) with a [BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS), while Kadaj is a nobody with a smaller, double-bladed sword. Sephiroth worked largely alone and through his control over Jenova, while Kadaj works with his independent "brothers". Finally, while Sephiroth will always be Cloud's [Arch-Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArchEnemy), he ultimately ends up with the hero's pity.

[Dark Messiah](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkMessiah): Presents himself as one to the children with Geostigma, declaring they are a family chosen by the stigma, and that he can heal them and take them to their mother to take back the planet together.

[Disc-One Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneFinalBoss): He's [The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy) of the film and the leader of the remnants, but is defeated by Cloud just before he triggers Sephiroth's rebirth. The *Complete* [Updated Re-release](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UpdatedRerelease) makes it clearer that he's just Sephiroth's pawn long before this is revealed at the climax.

[Dying as Yourself](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingAsYourself): In the final battle,  (SPOILER)  he takes enough blows for Sephiroth to lose control, causing Kadaj to spend his last few minutes of life as his old self.

[Enfante Terrible](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnfanteTerrible): [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) is that the youngest remnant was made their leader to give viewers the sense of an insane, unstoppable child.
[Fusion Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FusionDance): Merges with  (SPOILER) Jenova's cells, allowing Sephiroth to shapeshift Kadaj's body into his own and be reborn for real.
[Katanas Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter): Wields Souba, a katana with two parallel blades.
[No Body Left Behind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoBodyLeftBehind): Dissolves into Lifestream energy upon his death.

["Not So Different" Remark](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoDifferentRemark): Kadaj himself lampshades that Cloud knows all about being Sephiroth's puppet, confused and unsure of what to do and who he really is.
QUOTE "So what if I'm a puppet? Once upon a time, you were too!"
[Redemption in the Rain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedemptionInTheRain): The most sympathetic and tragic remnant dissolves into rain calling for his mother as he lays in Cloud's arms dying.

[The Unfavorite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUnfavorite): Considers himself such, sensing that his "mother" Jenova loves Sephiroth more than him. It's unclear how much of this is actually Jenova's will and how much is Kadaj interpreting Sephiroth's control of Jenova.

[Villainous Breakdown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainousBreakdown): Lets out an anguished wail and then quiets into sobs when he sees  (SPOILER) the "mother" he's been pursuing is a puddle of genetic goo.  After this Cloud arrives and he attacks him furiously.

[Woobie, Destroyer of Worlds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WoobieDestroyerOfWorlds): Kadaj has just enough understanding of what he's doing to realize he's just [The Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePawn) for Sephiroth's resurrection, but he doesn't understand how. At heart, he's a [Psychopathic Manchild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychopathicManchild) who's trying to find his mother and reunite his "family". When he finally does get his hands on Jenova and sees that the "mother" he's been looking for is just a puddle of genetic goo, he begins to cry and scream in anguish. Even Cloud seems to pity him, muttering "[I guess] a remnant wouldn't really know" when he realizes Kadaj really has no grasp of what he's doing.
[The Brute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBrute): The most physically dominating of the remnants and easily the most powerful.

[Dumb Muscle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DumbMuscle): He's very stupid and childish, making sound effects when he rides his motorcycle and crying over Jenova at times. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) says they intended him more as a [Manchild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManChild) rather than plain stupid, but admit he ended up being this trope too.

[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): His physical strength is immense, allowing him to punch apart trees, and he moves so fast he appears to [Flash Step](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlashStep) in a blur of white light.
[Manchild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManChild): His defining trait is his childish behavior. His movements and emotional states are deliberately exaggerated to emphasize this.
[Power Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFist): His weapon is the Dual Hound, a spiked taser-like gauntlet that adds [electric shocks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe) to his punches.

[Super-Speed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSpeed): Can move so fast his body is covered in white energy. A special animation tool was even designed by the staff that let them slow down the movie for the other characters while Loz moved normally, resulting in this trope when the film played normally.
[Creepy Monotone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreepyMonotone): Barely raises his voice beyond a soft and easy rhythm.

[Gun Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunFu): While they're used much more often for shooting, the Velvet Nightmares have blades running along their length and are sturdy in design, and they're used as melee weapons when needed.
[Guns Akimbo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunsAkimbo): Occasionally uses both his own and Loz's Velvet Nightmares at once.
[The Gunslinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGunslinger): Wields a gunblade called Velvet Nightmare. Loz has one as well, but Yazoo uses his much more often while Loz relies on his fists.
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): Calm, cool and collected.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): *Sephiroth* of all people is impressed with her skill when she manages to endure his attacks.
[Anti-Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiVillain): She really does want to protect the planet from Shinra. She's just willing to go to extremes to do it.
[Badass Cape](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCape): Wears a dull grey cloak.
[Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad): As the leader of AVALANCHE, she's the primarily antagonist of *Before Crisis*.  (SPOILER) At first .

[A Father to His Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AFatherToHisMen): She cares for AVALANCHE as her own family and fights alongside them on the front lines, unwilling to sit back and let them fight for her.
[Hopeless Boss Fight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessBossFight): The first encounter with her is impossible to win.
[Katanas Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter): Her weapon of choice is a katana, though of a more practical size than Sephiroth's.
[Laser-Guided Amnesia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserGuidedAmnesia): She has no memories from before she joined AVALANCHE.
[Luke, You Are My Father](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LukeYouAreMyFather): She's  (SPOILER) Veld's  daughter, presumed dead.

[Not Quite Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotQuiteDead): Three times in fact.  (SPOILER) Veld assumes Felicia dead when their hometown is attacked, but she's retrieved and used as an experiment by Hojo. He decides she's a failure and orders her disposed of, but Fuhito takes her to safety. And then at the end of *Before Crisis*, she's assumed dead due to the Zirconiade Materia finally taking its toll, but she and Veld are taken care of in secret and eventually go into hiding together .
[Only Known By Her Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyKnownByHerNickname): Her real name is  (SPOILER) Felicia  instead of Elfé.

[Power Degeneration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerDegeneration): Has common, standard superpowers due to  (SPOILER) the Zirconiade Materia imbedded in her arm . It also happens to be draining her life force and will eventually kill her.
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): She doesn't show a lot of emotion.
[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn):  (SPOILER) Fuhito  was just using her and AVALANCHE for his own schemes.
[Amazon Chaser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazonChaser): Thinks so of Elfé.
[Barefisted Monk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarefistedMonk): He fights with his bare hands.
[Co-Dragons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoDragons): With Fuhito, he's Elfé's second-in-command.
[Defeat Means Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansFriendship): He used to lead his own rebellion on Shinra, until he ran into Elfé. She kicked his ass, and he and his men joined AVALANCHE.
[Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn): After Veld  (SPOILER) abandons the Turks to try and help Elfé , Shears leaves AVALANCHE to try and help him and the Turks.
[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss): He's fought several times throughout the game.
[Co-Dragons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoDragons): With Shears, he's Elfé's second-in-command.
[Dragon Ascendant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonAscendant): After Shears leaves the group and Elfé is too weak to do it herself, Fuhito takes over command of AVALANCHE.
[Four Eyes, Zero Soul](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourEyesZeroSoul): Like Hojo, he wears glasses. He's also just as evil and amoral.
[The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy): He's behind most of AVALANCHE's plans in the game.
[Mad Scientist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist): He idolizes *Hojo*, and orders an AVALANCHE attack on Shinra's headquarters in the hopes of being able to meet him and show off his Ravens.
[The Man Behind the Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheManBehindTheMan): He's the real force controlling AVALANCHE.

[Omnicidal Maniac](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OmnicidalManiac): Believes that the Planet is too weakened thanks to Shinra's actions and wants to kill all human life so their energy will return to the Lifestream and the Planet can heal without their interference.  (SPOILER) This is why he wants to summon Zirconiade, because it will be his tool to do the job.
[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel): He merges with  (SPOILER) Zirconiade  to fight you in the final chapter.
[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss): You fight him over and over during the game.

[You Have Outlived Your Usefulness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouHaveOutlivedYourUsefulness): He tries to pull this on AVALANCHE's benefactor.  (SPOILER) This is also his eventual goal for all of AVALANCHE, Elfé and Shears included .
[Cheerful Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CheerfulChild): She is very well-adjusted and happy considering what she's been through.

[Children Are Innocent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildrenAreInnocent): Due to her age she doesn't fully understand what goes on around her. The intro to *Advent Children* has her explain Sephiroth's plan to kill all life and become a god as "Sephiroth hated the planet so much, he wanted to make it go away."
[Daddy's Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DaddysGirl): She adores Barret as much as a biological dad.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Come *Advent Children*, she's begun to grow into a dry wit.
QUOTE **Marlene:** You've been trying so hard to find a cure for Denzel.  
**Cloud:** You knew about that?  
**Marlene:** Cloud, you should clean up your desk once in a while.

[Generation Xerox](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenerationXerox): Despite no family resemblance, she looks a lot like Aerith, and even has her iconic hairstyle with a ribbon in *Advent Children*. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) says she's picking up Tifa's stubbornness too, making her a combination of the two women.
[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): By Barret. Also by Cloud and Tifa in later follow-ups in the *Compilation*.

[Morality Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityPet): To Barret. She is the only thing keeping him from going off the deep end. Barret is aware of this trope and notes if he didn't have Marlene motivating him to be a good dad for her, he may have become something worse a long time ago.
[Plucky Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyGirl): She's eternally cheerful and upbeat, which is impressive considering the stuff she went through.
[Protected by a Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProtectedByAChild): Marlene does this for Tifa by throwing a Materia at Loz's head.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): She calls out Cloud on his angst in *Advent Children Complete*, imitating Barret for good measure. "How are you supposed to look after your family if you can't even look after yourself?"
[Wise Beyond Their Years](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WiseBeyondTheirYears): She shows a remarkable amount of maturity for a 6 year old.
[Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor): Living in the ruins of Midgar turned him from a normal kid to a resourceful scavenger.

[Flat Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlatCharacter): He doesn't get a lot of personality to build on in *Advent Children*; justified since he's fatally ill for much of it and not fully coherent for it. His novella expands on his character more.
[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): Twice; both by Reeve's mother and, eventually, by Cloud and Tifa.
[Heartwarming Orphan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeartwarmingOrphan): Despite living in absolute misery, he eventually found a loving family.
[Littlest Cancer Patient](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittlestCancerPatient): He has Geostigma and curing him is an important subplot.
[Lower-Deck Episode](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LowerDeckEpisode): His novella serves to demonstrate how Midgar's civilian population handled the events of *VII*.

[Street Urchin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StreetUrchin): After Meteorfall he ran with a gang of street orphans in the ruins of Sector 7, collecting and trading scrap for food. Many of the kids were too stubborn to give up their independence, at first. But when the heavy machinery moved in and Geostigma became more widespread, the gang started to break up. Eventually Denzel was the only member left, and he wandered the streets for a time before being found by Cloud.
[Upper-Class Twit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UpperClassTwit): Has shades of this since his parents were too; he thinks slum people eat rats for instance.

[Wise Beyond Their Years](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WiseBeyondTheirYears): In contrast to the above, Denzel may be young but he's no fool. In both the novel & short film; he overheard his father's convo with a fellow employee about who was really responsible for the sector 7 plate crash. Not once believing a word of what a [Shin-Ra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NebulousEvilOrganisation) infantryman said when he oversaw the wreckage when thinking of his lost parents.

[Big Sister Instinct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigSisterInstinct): She had a little brother and takes care of him, since both of them suffer Geostigma.
    - She wiped her little brother's face after being splash by other kids that run by a puddle. - She covers his eyes when seeing a man suffer Geostigma melted right in front of them. - She carried him all around, (SPOILER) even though he's already dying .
[Littlest Cancer Patient](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittlestCancerPatient): She also suffers from Geostigma the same as Denzel.

[Missing Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingChild): She and other children with Geostigma are kidnapped by the Silver Haired Men and brainwashed by them.  (SPOILER) Not only that knowing your kids died because Geostigma is what happened to her little brother.
[No Name Given](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoNameGiven): Moogle Girl is never called by her real name, even the credits just title her *Girl*.

[Barred from the Afterlife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarredFromTheAfterlife):  According to *[Final Fantasy VII Ultimania Omega](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual)* the three of them were barred from entering the Lifestream after they died because of all the people they killed blowing up the Mako reactors.
[Big Fun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFun): Wedge is friendly and by his own admittance, rolly-polly.
[Forgotten Fallen Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForgottenFallenFriend): Averted. Their deaths weigh on Barret through most of the game, and he talks about them from time to time.
[Karmic Nod](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KarmicNod): Because their actions killed so many people, all three of them feel that their deaths are well-deserved during their final moments.
[Mauve Shirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MauveShirt): All of them are given a distinct personality, which makes their deaths early on in the plot all the more dramatic.

[Ms. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsExposition): Jessie has a conversation with Cloud in which she gives him a rundown of Midgar that largely serves to inform the player about the city's overall structure.
[Rescue Romance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RescueRomance): Downplayed with Jessie. She develops a crush on Cloud after he saves her from getting stuck as the Sector 1 Reactor is about to explode.

[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): Despite not being related to Aerith by blood, she treats her as her own daughter and loves her dearly. She even offers to look after Marlene later in the game after the destruction of Sector 7.

[I Will Wait for You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWillWaitForYou): When her husband didn't come back from the war, she waited for his arrival every day at the train station, until she was told that he had been killed in action.

[Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear): A non-violent example; she's very protective of Aerith, to the point of asking Cloud to leave her home without telling Aerith when she realizes that he's a SOLDIER.
[Muggle Foster Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MuggleFosterParents): She is one to Aerith, the last Cetra in the world.

[Outliving One's Offspring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutlivingOnesOffspring):  (SPOILER) She lose Aerith because of Sephiroth. The Main Party blames themselves for Aerith's death. But, Elmyra makes it clear she doesn't blame them for Aerith's death.

[Doesn't Trust Those Guys](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoesntTrustThoseGuys): Zangan's travels reveal that a lot of passersby's shared stories about how the Shin-Ra go around quelling and/or silencing any possibly harmful content related to the company that might hurt they're public image. The aftermath of Nibelheim incident proved such rumors correct.
[Old Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OldMaster): is this to Tifa who training martial arts. He even boasts training martial arts to 128 students across the world.
[Passing the Torch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PassingTheTorch): He gives his secret technique *Final Heaven* to Tifa because "he can't even jump anymore". Which serves as her final Limit Break.

[Small Role, Big Impact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallRoleBigImpact): He only appears briefly in the Nibelheim flashback, but if not for him, Tifa likely wouldn't have survived, ended up in Midgar, joined AVALANCHE, or reunited with Cloud and start him off on his journey.
[Cool Old Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolOldGuy): 130 years old and one of the most knowledgeable people in the world. There's a reason he commands so much respect in Cosmo Canyon.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): A non-fighting variation when he accompanies the party  (SPOILER) to the City of the Ancients in order to unlock the secrets of the White Materia.
[Life Will Kill You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LifeWillKillYou):  (SPOILER) He passes away from old age near the end of the game, right after giving Red XIII his ultimate weapon.
[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): He exists largely to give info dumps on topics most other characters in the game are ignorant of, primarily the Lifestream and the Cetra.
[Parental Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalSubstitute): He's taken care of Red XIII for decades since his parents are gone.
[Power Floats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFloats): He inexplicably floats on a large green orb at all times.
[Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut): He's named after the archeologist in *[The Omen (1976)](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Film/TheOmen1976)* who tells the hero the lore of the Anti-Christ.
[Signature Laugh](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignatureLaugh): "Ho ho hoooo!"

[Amazingly Embarrassing Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazinglyEmbarrassingParents): Cloud meets with his mother who worries about him, especially concerning getting a girlfriend. Which annoyed Cloud a bit.
[Deceased Parents Are the Best](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeceasedParentsAreTheBest): Thanks to Sephiroth, Cloud lost his mother due to the [Nibelheim incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown).

[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): Towards Cloud. Cloud even describes his mother as “vibrant” and once invited Zack to come to his house and try her cooking. Her death at the hands of Sephiroth is one of his (many) grudges against him.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She died five years before the game starts, during the Nibelheim Incident. In *Remake*, Sephiroth reveals that he killed her.

[Supreme Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupremeChef): Cloud loved his mother cooking. It's to the point that he invited Zack to come over to his mother's house and try her cooking. The early character sheets say her specialty is stew.

[Unnamed Parent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnnamedParent): She isn't named in the original game. Although, the early character sheets apparently had her named *Claudia Strauss*. Her given name was canonized in *Remake*, but her family name is still Strife, like her son's.
[Deceased Parents Are the Best](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeceasedParentsAreTheBest): Thanks to Sephiroth, Tifa lost her father due to the [Nibelheim incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown).

[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): Towards Tifa. When he about to die after being killed by Sephiroth, his last word to Tifa is to run away so Tifa didn't get hurt. As result, Tifa declares her hatred for Shinra, SOLDIER, mako, and Sephiroth.

[Misplaced Retribution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MisplacedRetribution): Tifa was so torn up over her mother's death that she tried to find her mom in the Nibel mountains. Cloud followed her, and they both fell into a ravine when the bridge to the reactor broke. Tifa's father mistakenly thought Cloud was the one who led Tifa into the mountains and yelled at him for his supposed carelessness. It's implied this is one of the things that led Cloud to see himself as weak and needing to become stronger.
[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): He died five years before the game starts, killed by Sephiroth during the Nibelheim incident.

[Unnamed Parent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnnamedParent): He isn't named ingame. Although, the early character sheets named him as *Brian Lockhart*, which was canonized as his name in *Remake*'s Ultimania guide.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): He mistakenly thinks Cloud took Tifa into the Nibel mountains where they fell and she ended up in a week-long coma. He warns Cloud to stay away from Tifa even when he returns to Nibelheim with Sephiroth.

[Heel Realization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelRealization): After Yuffie defeats him in battle, Godo tells her that the war made him realize that in using their power to fight, Wutai was no different from Shinra, and now realizes from Yuffie that to make a true difference, one needs not just strength, but determination.

[Retired Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass): Implied to have been a fierce warrior and an independent king, standing up against the Shinra Electric Power Company to defend Wutai's honor and culture. Now, he is thought by Yuffie to be a shell of his former self who spends the day sleeping and has let Wutai become a tourist resort.
[Happily Married](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyMarried): After she and Cid reconciled. They got married as of *[Dirge of Cerberus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DirgeOfCerberus)*.

[It's All My Fault](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllMyFault): Thinking it's her fault Cid's dream shattered. She even takes all Cid's constant criticism believing she deserves it.  (SPOILER) In reality, it's not really her fault; there was a fault with the rocket oxygen tanks and she was trying to fix it.
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Despite the hardships that followed the event, she is still a caring person.
[Abhorrent Admirer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbhorrentAdmirer): He's head over heels for Tifa, even proclaiming that she's his girlfriend. She can only sigh in exasperation.
[Fiery Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FieryRedhead): Has bright reddish hair and a short temper to match.
[Hopeless Suitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessSuitor): He is in love with Tifa and utterly convinced she is his girlfriend, to her exasperation.

[Throw the Dog a Bone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowTheDogABone): After Johnny left Midgar and moved to Costa del Sol, He started a "new life", moved into a house, and met a girl who became his girlfriend. Johnny even revealed that he had proposed to his girlfriend.
[Color-Coded Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorCodedEyes): Like her daughter, Ifalna had vivid green eyes to show her connection to the planet and the lifestream.
[Last of Her Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastOfHerKind): The last pureblood Cetra; Aerith is only half-Cetra.
[Missing Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingMom): She died when Aerith was seven years old from injuries she sustained while escaping Shinra Tower.
[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): Her video logs of her talking to Gast explain a lot of the backstory.
[Orphan's Plot Trinket](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrphansPlotTrinket): Leaves the White Materia to Aerith, the only memento she has of her.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): She's been dead for well over a decade by the time the game begins. She appears only in flashbacks and in a series of video interviews Professor Gast has with her.
[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): Her model and concept art depict her as looking just like Aerith, even wearing a red dress.
[Artificial Limbs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialLimbs): She has a robotic left arm as a prosthetic. The backstory also establishes she was the one who gave Barret his gun-arm.
[Coat Cape](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoatCape): She wears a lap coat slung over her shoulders like a cloak.

[Disney Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyDeath): Possibly. Her body is recovered and put in a medical capsule, but Yuffie says she has too much head trauma and will never wake up, and come to the end of the game her broken capsule is left in Midgar's ruins as Omega is destroyed and the Lifestream rains down on her, so there's a chance she'll return. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) says they purposefully left her survival open to interpretation to look at in future games.

[Dying Declaration of Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingDeclarationOfLove): Platonic example. She says this towards  (SPOILER) Shelke  before Azul gives her head trauma.
QUOTE **Shalua**: "And remember, I'll always love you."

[Gory Discretion Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoryDiscretionShot): We don't see precisely *what* Azul does to her behind the door, but when she's being cared for afterward it's mentioned she has head trauma.
[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): Apparently dies helping Vincent and Shelke escape Azul.
[Luke, I Am Your Father](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LukeIAmYourFather): Her sister turns out to be  (SPOILER) Shelke .
[Stripperiffic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperiffic): It's a mystery where she buys clothes that look like *that*.

[A.I. Is a Crapshoot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AIIsACrapshoot): Sephiroth is meant to be the immediate threat that the Weapons were supposed to take down once they were awakened. However, in an ironic twist, he sealed himself off at the crater's energy barrier; the only place the Weapons can't meddle with because the crater is still healing from JENOVA's descent into the Planet. Due to Sephiroth sealing himself off essentially, the awakened Weapons are left confused as to why they awakened and move on to strike the next immediate threats sucking the Planet dry, being Junon and Midgard.
[Attack of the 50-Foot Whatever](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttackOfTheFiftyFootWhatever): The Weapons are massive, towering over skyscrapers.

[Beam Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeamSpam): Most of them attack with an assortment of rays and lasers. Emerald Weapon's four Eyes that accompany it only have one attack, Emerald Laser, so you'll be seeing a lot of it.
[Big Creepy-Crawlies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigCreepyCrawlies): Jade Weapon heavily resembles an insect of sorts, primarily a beetle.
[Boom, Headshot!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoomHeadshot): Sapphire Weapon gets a point-blank blast from Junon's Mako Cannon, obliterating its head.

[Boss-Altering Consequence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossAlteringConsequence): The Emerald Weapon normally has a 20 minute timer during the fight due to taking place underwater. However, if you obtain the Underwater Materia, that timer will be removed.

[Bragging Rights Reward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BraggingRightsReward): The rewards for defeating Ruby and Emerald are rewards that can be traded for a set of unique Master Materia, and a Gold Chocobo. But if you're strong enough to beat them, you've defeated the game's most powerful enemies, so you don't need those items now.

[Breath Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreathWeapon): Sapphire Weapon's attack is a blast of energy from its mouth. Ruby Weapon and Ultimate Weapon also fire projectiles from their mouths. Emerald Weapon also fires an energy beam from the [mouth-like orifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror) in the center of its body.

[Casting a Shadow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastingAShadow): Ruby Weapon and Ultimate Weapon can cast Shadow Flare. Ultimate Weapon will use the attack as a parting shot should one be able to kill him; he'll usually attack his killer, so make sure they're the one holding the Enemy Skill Materia.
[Chest Blaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChestBlaster): Ultimate Weapon and Ruby Weapon fire attacks from orbs on their chests.

[Color-Coded Characters](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorCodedCharacters): One is red, one is green, one is blue, one is white, and one is black and purple. The additional weapons added in later games are dark green, and silver.
[Combat Tentacles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatTentacles): Ruby Weapon's arms.

[Contrasting Sequel Antagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContrastingSequelAntagonist): Omega's purpose turns out to be a dark twist on what Jenova does (and what Sephiroth would later plan to do) to planets. Jenova is a human-sized extraterrestrial invader who absorbs all the energy of a planet and then uses it as a vessel to travel to another and repeat the process. Omega is a biomechanical creation of the Planet itself, whose purpose is to absorb the Lifestream and find a new planet when the [Godzilla Threshold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodzillaThreshold) is reached.
[Cool Plane](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolPlane): What Jade Weapon can best be described as.

[Cowardly Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CowardlyBoss): After doing enough damage to Ultimate Weapon in any fight with it except the last, it flies off. After fighting Diamond Weapon (assuming it is not the original Japanese 1.0 version), you then have to chase it down across the Planet to get back into battle with it except for the last fight, where it will be stationed over Cosmo Canyon.

[Cutscene Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutsceneBoss): Sapphire Weapon is blasted by the Sister Ray and never fights the heroes. The same was true of Diamond Weapon in the original Japanese release, but all later releases add a mandatory fight against it.
[Detachment Combat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DetachmentCombat): Emerald Weapon separates its entire top half from its lower half in order to use Aire Tam Storm
[Dishing Out Dirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DishingOutDirt): When Ruby Weapon takes away two of your party members to fight only one, he does so by sucking them into quicksand.
[Dragon Their Feet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonTheirFeet): Jade Weapon is released by Zirconiade and serves as an antagonist after the latter had already been taken out by the heroes.

[Duel Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DuelBoss): Ruby Weapon's [Whirlsand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuicksandSucks) attack [permanently takes two party members out of the fight,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeaderThanDead) eventually making it one-on-one. [The only way to avoid this](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuideDangIt) (or at least have a choice in who gets taken out) is to enter the fight with two party members already dead.

[Elemental Powers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalPowers): Each Weapon appears to be based around a particular element. Diamond is earth, Ruby is fire, Ultimate is air, Sapphire is water, and Emerald is energy (despite also being water-based).

[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): The Ruby, Diamond and Emerald Weapons resemble the [MSM-03C Hygogg](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/MobileSuitGundam0080WarInThePocket), [AMX-004 Qubeley and AMX-002 Neue Ziel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/ZetaGundam), respectively.

[Four Is Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourIsDeath): Four of the Weapons can be fought as bosses in VII (two HAVE to be fought to complete the game), and all four are very powerful and very dangerous.

["Get Back Here!" Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GetBackHereBoss):
    - Ultimate Weapon fights a few rounds, then flies away to be chased down and fought again until you whittle it down to nothing. - Jade Weapon retreats each time it would be defeated in Before Crisis.

[Godzilla Threshold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodzillaThreshold): They are the Godzilla in the trope name — when the planet is in dire danger or some threat appears that could cause mass destruction, the Weapons awaken to fight it off. Omega is the final one of these — when the other Weapons are gone and the planet is in danger still, it awakens to gather the Lifestream and take it to another planet to escape the threat, leaving the old planet to wither and die.

[Hufflepuff House](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HufflepuffHouse): Despite being played up as the planet's most powerful defenses against threats, they usually get less and less relevant for each subsequent appearance.
    - Jade Weapon, chronologically the first of the Weapons to be released, is the [Arc](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArcVillain) [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad) of the [Weapon Mode](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PostClimaxConfrontation) of Before Crisis, following the destruction of Zirconiade and serving as the *incredibly* persistent [True Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueFinalBoss) of the story. However, Before Crisis has been completely shut down since March 31, 2018. - Sapphire Weapon, the first to be introduced and establish the Weapons as a threat, [is almost immediately taken out in a cutscene without any player input](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutsceneBoss). - Diamond Weapon couldn't even be fought in the original Japanese version, though that did get rectified later as a mandatory fight. Even so, it easily played the biggest part in the story by causing the Raid on Midgar. - Ultimate Weapon was the only one that *had* to be fought, regardless of which version of the game you played, and devastating Mideel as soon as it shows up, but after fleeing the scene, it doesn't play a role again other than as a [Recurring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss) superboss. - Emerald & Ruby Weapon are [Superbosses](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Superboss) that don't play a role in the story, the only thing they do being awakening from the North Crater. - Omega, an even bigger case of [Godzilla Threshold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodzillaThreshold), only shows up around the end of Dirge of Cerberus before it's tricked and taken over by Deepground and Weiss.

[Kaiju](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Kaiju): They're enormous monsters who wreak havoc on humanity, so this is a given. For added points, they represent [Gaia's Vengeance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GaiasVengeance) and all have a vaguely humanoid shape that harkens back to the [People in Rubber Suits](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PeopleInRubberSuits) effect that Toho typically employed.
[Knight Templar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightTemplar): They exist to protect the planet from threats, but their only method for doing so is to destroy those threats.

[Marathon Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MarathonBoss): If you wish to fight Emerald and/or Ruby Weapon, you will be dealing with them for at least 15 minutes each (unless the player does Cait Sith's [One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill) slot move or is underpowered; in the latter, the two Weapons will break AVALANCE apart in only a few moves). Chasing Ultimate Weapon also can take a while.

[Mysterious Mist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysteriousMist): An area being clouded in black mist is the telltale sign that the Jade Weapon is present in a certain location, only able to be penetrated by the light from several Materia Pillars across the planet.
[Off with His Head!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffWithHisHead): Sapphire Weapon's head is blown off by a point blank shot from the Sister Ray.

[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill): When fighting Emerald Weapon, make sure at least one person has less than 9 Materia on them; anyone who has 9 Materia or more equipped will be subject to this trope via Emerald's ultimate attack.  (SPOILER) Which can be reversed by [Loophole Abuse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoopholeAbuse) by equipping your characters with two Materia that bring your up health to 9999. when it uses Aire Tam Storm it'll deal 2222 damage, trigger All Lucky 7s and take off a significant chunk of Emerald Weapon's health. With the proper build to back this up, one can subject Emerald Weapon to a [Curb-Stomp Battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CurbStompBattle).

[Organic Technology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrganicTechnology): They're 2000-year old bio-mechanical weapons spawned by [The Lifestream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLifestream) that appear to have mechanical workings and weapons.
[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): Ruby Weapon's Ruby Flame.
[Predecessor Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PredecessorVillain): As Before Crisis was set before VII itself, Jade Weapon is this to the rest of the Weapons.
[Purple Is the New Black](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PurpleIsTheNewBlack): Ultimate Weapon is referred to as the black Weapon, but is mostly purple with some black coloring.
[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss): In total, the Jade Weapon takes around **nine battles at each location across the planet** before it's decommissioned.

[Recurring Element](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringElement): This wouldn't be the first time there was a [Superboss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Superboss) named Ultima(te) Weapon, though this is easily the most famous and powerful version, [as well as the most reoccurring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LegacyBossBattle).
[Sdrawkcab Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SdrawkcabName): The "Aire Tam" in Emerald Weapon's "Aire Tam Storm" is "Materia" spelled backwards, clueing you in as to what influences it.

[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe):
    - Aside from Ultima Beam, Ultimate Weapon attacks by shooting orbs of lightning at party members. - Emerald Weapon's ultimate attack is called Aire-Tam Storm, which has him engulfing the entire party in a thunderbolt shower. This attack does 1,111 points worth of damage for every Materia a character has equipped, so if somebody has 9 or more...
[Shoulder Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoulderCannon): Emerald Weapon is armed with four, while Diamond Weapon has a series of flare launchers in its shoulders.
[Shoulders of Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShouldersOfDoom): They also rock absolutely *massive* ones.

[Sixth Ranger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SixthRanger): Jade Weapon first appears in Before Crisis, though it chronologically is the first to awaken. The Omega Weapon itself appears in Dirge of Cerberus.

[Skewed Priorities](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SkewedPriorities): They come to life to [protect the planet from whatever endangers it.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodzillaThreshold) In this case, they go after humanity as a whole, who are only progressively destroying the planet, instead of Sephiroth, whose threat level to the planet is *much* more immediate. It is implied that the energy shield around the northern crater not only protects Sephiroth, but also hides him from/confuses the Weapons.

[Superboss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Superboss): All of them except [Sapphire Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutsceneBoss) and Diamond Weapon are optional encounters. Ultimate Weapon has to be fought once but survives, and can be fought and killed at the player's choosing.
[Taking You with Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingYouWithMe): If AVALANCHE is able to destroy Ultimate Weapon, he'll use Shadow Flare as a final attack.

[Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThemeNaming):
    - The Weapons are Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, Diamond, and [Ultimate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddNameOut). Jade continues the trend, but not Omega, but then Omega is a special member of the group. - Also carries into their attacks, which are named after them. Diamond Weapon for example uses Diamond Fire and Diamond Flash.

[Time-Limit Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeLimitBoss): Emerald Weapon is found on the seafloor after obtaining the submarine, and fighting him normally down here will give the team only 20 minutes to kill him before they drown and cause an automatic [Game Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameOver). Obtaining the Underwater Materia from the Kalm Traveler (you need to give him a Guide Book that has to be Morphed off one of the Ghost Ships in the underwater corridor connecting Junon to the Underwater Reactor) will remove the timer and allow the team to fight indefinitely. [You will (probably) need the extra time.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamageSpongeBoss)
[True Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueFinalBoss): Jade Weapon is the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) of Before Crisis' Weapon Mode, set after the destruction of Zirconiade.
[Underwater Boss Battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnderwaterBossBattle): Emerald Weapon is fought at the bottom of the ocean, and not even while you're in the submarine either.

[The Unfought](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUnfought): Sapphire Weapon is destroyed by Shinra before the party ever gets to fight it. In the first release of the Japanese version of the game, Diamond Weapon suffered the same fate, but the International version added a mandatory boss fight against him that was also added to later Japanese releases.

[Unfulfilled Purpose Misery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnfulfilledPurposeMisery): Zirconiade awakened Jade Weapon in order to protect itself, but by the time it arrived, Zirconiade was already destroyed. Without a purpose, it focused on attacking the Turks rather than returning to rest, [as they had technically destroyed a part of the Planet's ecology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoopholeAbuse).
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Easily the most powerful enemy in *Crisis Core*.
[Badass Cape](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCape): Wears a pair of large white cloaks that hang from her armor.
[Big Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood): Guardian of the Lifestream, goddess of LOVELESS, and protector of the planet.

tropeName: Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?
tropeNotes: [Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustPunchOutCthulhu): Zack will probably do this literally since Costly Punch is what you're likely going to be spamming against her.
[Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning): Crimson Flare, Krysta, and Thor's Hammer.
[Gold and White Are Divine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoldAndWhiteAreDivine): Wears gold and white armor and has blond hair.

[Good Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodCounterpart): As a goddess who embodies the will of the Lifestream, she's a Good Counterpart to Jenova and Sephiroth, false gods who try to corrupt the Lifestream.

tropeName: Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairOfGoldHeartOfGold): As part of her appearance of a noble goddess and the good embodiment of the Lifestream.
[Hot Goddess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotGoddess): She is very lovely to look at and happens to be a deity.

[It Is Not Your Time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItIsNotYourTime): [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) states this was her motive for curing Genesis of his degradation and bringing him back shortly after Zack struck him down as he had yet to complete his duty as SOLDIER and he still had much to learn.

tropeName: Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me
tropeNotes: [Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckilyMyShieldWillProtectMe): Wields a shield on her left armor.
[Magic Staff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicStaff): Her weapon is designed like a staff but comes to a point with bladed protrusions.
[Morph Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MorphWeapon): Her shield, spear/staff, and armor and cape, come apart and combine to form a giant bow and arrow for Judgement Arrow.
[No Cure for Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCureForEvil): Unfortunately she isn't evil, hence Blessing Light.
[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): She cures Genesis of his degradation after seeing his pure desire and will to complete his duty as a SOLDIER.
